line: [1/2] Caravan Driver: Agh!
[2/2] Tasim: Hey, soldier! Are you alright in there? It looks like we've hit something.
[1/5] Caravan Driver: Hm... I swear I hit this same darn boulder every time I make this trip. Sorry folks.
[2/5] Tasim: Ah. Does this mean we have to walk all the way to Ragni from here?
[3/5] Caravan Driver: Unfortunately. Luckily, it's not that far from here. Just a straight path forward.
[4/5] Aledar: Well, nothing to do but keep moving! Tasim, soldier, I'll race you to the gate!
[5/5] Tasim: Wait, don't!-... He's already gone. We'll have to catch up to him. soldier, lead the way.
[1/4] Tasim: I don't suppose you know much about Wynn either, do you?
[2/4] Tasim: Of course, the King of Ragni's been recruiting Fruma soldiers, but...
[3/4] Tasim: That war of theirs must be getting pretty bad if they need this much support.
[4/4] Tasim: Oh, there's Aledar! And the gate, by the looks of it.
[1/4] Aledar: There you two are! You'll have to be faster than that if you want to stand a chance against the undead.
[2/4] Tasim: Yes, yes, we'll be faster next time. So, is this the gate marking the border between Wynn and Fruma?
[3/4] Aledar: It looks like it, yep! Are you two ready for the start of our new lives? Here we go!
[4/4] Aledar: Well, what are you waiting for?
[1/3] Tasim: So this is the Wynn we've all been hearing about... It's beautiful.
[2/3] Aledar: I guess the war hasn't made it this far. This is what we'll be fighting to protect.
[3/3] Soldier: Hey, recruits! Come over here, I have something to tell you.
[1/4] Tasim: A soldier? What are you doing all the way out here?
[2/4] Soldier: There's a bit of trouble up ahead. They sent me out here to intercept new recruits.
[3/4] Soldier: Do you see this cave over here? Caves such as these often contain useful loot that can help keep you alive. If you enter the cave, you can find armour to protect you.
[4/4] Aledar: Well, you heard the man! Let's go get geared up.
[1/1] Aledar: Don't leave yet! I'd love to keep going, but first we need to get protection.
[1/1] Soldier: Enter this cave and find yourself some armour.
[1/1] Tasim: You heard the soldier. Let's enter the cave and find some armour.
[1/1] Aledar: Hmph. The soldier didn't tell us the cave path was collapsed! We'll have to jump through.
[1/3] Tasim: Well, this is a problem... I don't think we can make this jump.
[2/3] Aledar: Hm. There's got to be some way to... Oh! What if we could break that rock on the ceiling?
[3/3] Tasim: ...And then it would fall and open up a path for us! soldier, left-click the rock to attack and break it!
[1/1] Aledar: It worked! Now we can reach that chest!
[1/1] Tasim: You can right-click a loot chest to open it.
[1/1] Aledar: Anything good in there? Come on, let's get back to that soldier.
[1/1] Aledar: Oh, you fell! Try doing it again.
[1/5] Soldier: Hm... Yes, that looks like it'll do.
[2/5] Soldier: Normally these outskirts are pretty safe, but we've had some corrupted forces slip through recently.
[3/5] Soldier: We're not entirely sure how they got here... Either way, they've been causing chaos. They've even managed to destroy the bridge!
[4/5] Soldier: ... In any case. You've noticed your loot is currently unidentified, yes? You'll be able to identify it at the Item Identifier further down the path, on your left.
[5/5] Aledar: Alright. Thanks for the warning! We'll be sure to stay safe. soldier, lead the way!
[1/1] Aledar: soldier, you're going the wrong way!
[1/1] Tasim: Hey, don't leave yet! We still need to check out the identifier and head on to the bridge!
[1/2] Tasim: Oh, that must be the item identifier the soldier mentioned.
[2/2] Aledar: Right. soldier, you can right-click the identifier to identify your item! Let us know when you're done.
[1/2] Aledar: You've got it identified? Great! Let's keep moving.
[2/2] Tasim: Hm... The soldier said something about the bridge being destroyed. Maybe we should check it out.
[1/8] Tasim: Well, that soldier wasn't kidding. This is some serious damage...
[2/8] Aledar: Well, how are we meant to get to the other side of this ravine now? Ugh. Another thing gone wrong, just like-...
[3/8] Tasim: ... Aledar? What's wrong?
[4/8] Aledar: That's... weird. I was just thinking about something from before Wynn, but... it's gone. I can't remember.
[5/8] Tasim: Hm. I can't remember anything from Fruma either... soldier, how about you?
[6/8] Aledar: Nothing. It can't be a coincidence we've all lost our memories at the same time, right?
[7/8] Tasim: No, but... We can worry about that later. For now, we need to find a way past this ravine. Aledar, soldier, you should look around for a way across. I'll keep looking here.
[8/8] Aledar: Yeah... Alright. Let's go, soldier.
[1/1] Tasim: Be careful, soldier! Don't want you falling off the edge.
[1/1] Tasim: Hey, don't leave yet! We still need to figure out a way across the gap.
[1/2] Aledar: Woah! That's one way of doing it, I guess! Hey, Tasim, over here!
[2/2] Tasim: Good work! You two, go on ahead, I'll be just behind you.
[1/1] Aledar: Looks like that's the underpass up ahead... We just need to get through there, and we'll be at the castle!
[1/6] Guard: Ah, the new recruits. Wait there a moment. There's a spot of trouble up ahead.
[2/6] Tasim: What? What's going on?
[3/6] Guard: A group of the corrupted have sieged the underpass. It's not safe to go unarmed, so you'll need weapons.
[4/6] Guard: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a bow for you. There you are.
[4/6] Guard: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a wand for you. There you are.
[4/6] Guard: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a dagger for you. There you are.
[4/6] Guard: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a relik for you. There you are.
[4/6] Guard: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a spear for you. There you are.
[5/6] Aledar: Are we expected to fight already? I would have thought we'd need training first.
[6/6] Guard: In a perfect world, yes. But unfortunately, that trouble up ahead won't wait for you to train. Good luck, recruits.
[1/3] Aledar: What's going on?
[2/3] Tasim: I think that's one of the corrupted... soldier, get ready. You never know when it could...
[3/3] Tasim: Strike! Kill it, quickly!
[1/1] Aledar: Phew... Good work, soldier. Let's keep going.
[1/3] Tasim: Hm... Something's wrong. I think we're about to be...
[2/3] Tasim: ...ambushed.
[3/3] Aledar: soldier, take the one in the front! We'll handle the two in the back!
[1/2] Aledar: I think I'm starting to get the hang of this! These corrupted don't stand a chance!
[2/2] Tasim: Likewise. Alright, let's keep going. It shouldn't be too far now...
[1/9] Guard: Finally, some backup! Help me out here, would you?
[2/9] Tasim: What happened! Are you injured? Were you attacked by the corrupt?
[3/9] Guard: Injured, yes, but not by the undead. I'm well equipped for those. The issue is this here cave-in.
[4/9] Aledar: This isn't seriously the only way through, is it? There's got to be something we can do!
[5/9] Guard: If only I wasn't injured, I could just use my weapon to cast a spell on these boulders to get rid of them...
[6/9] Guard: ... You there, the quiet one with the bow. What's your name?
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're an Archer, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Hunter, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[8/9] Guard: You should be able to unlock your first ability... Just use your compass, and click on the ability tree on the left.
[9/9] Guard: Now, cast your Arrow Bomb spell by clicking Left-Right-Right!
[6/9] Guard: ... You there, the quiet one with the spear. What's your name?
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Knight, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Warrior, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[9/9] Guard: Now, cast your Bash spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!
[6/9] Guard: ... You there, the quiet one with the wand. What's your name?
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Dark Wizard, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Mage, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[9/9] Guard: Now, cast your Meteor spell by clicking Right-Left-Left!
[6/9] Guard: ... You there, the quiet one with the dagger. What's your name?
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're an Assassin, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Ninja, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[9/9] Guard: Now, cast your Spin Attack spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!
[6/9] Guard: ... You there, the quiet one with the relik. What's your name?
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Shaman, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[7/9] Guard: soldier. You're a Skyseer, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.
[9/9] Guard: Now, cast your Totem spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!
[1/1] Guard: Stand in front of the boulder and cast your spell by clicking Left-Right-Right!
[1/1] Guard: Stand in front of the boulder and cast your spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!
[1/1] Guard: Cast your spell by clicking Left-Right-Right!
[1/1] Guard: Cast your spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!
[1/1] Guard: Well done, recruit! It's a straight path to the castle from here. You three, head on towards the castle.
[1/2] Guard: ... Wait. What is THAT?!
[2/3] Guard: Aghh! Let me go!
[3/3] Tasim: Quickly, after that thing! We need to save the guard!
[1/1] Aledar: Hey, soldier! Castle's the other way!
[1/3] Guard: ... That was close. Thanks for the save!
[2/3] Guard: I think you three are going to make good recruits - not many can handle themselves like you just did.
[3/3] Guard: You should head on to the castle, now. I'll take care of any leftover corrupted.
[1/3] Aledar: We... we made it! We really made it! Gods, that was a close one at the end.
[2/3] Tasim: ... Still think those corrupted don't stand a chance against you?
[3/3] Aledar: Ha ha. Very funny. Let's just head inside and talk to the king.
[1/5] Tasim: ...oh, soldier! Over here. Aledar's gone on ahead, but I figured I'd stay back and wait for you to be done.
[2/5] Tasim: So! Wynn, huh? It's pretty exciting to finally be here. I'm going to head off in the direction of Detlas soon, but I wanted to tell you about something first.
[3/5] Tasim: There's this handy item we were all given on our way here- the Content Book. It displays most things you can do in this world- quests, caves, and more.
[4/5] Tasim: It also lets you track any content you want, which will create a beacon you can follow. Here, why don't you try it out? Use your content book, and click on the highlighted quest.
[5/5] Tasim: Well, there you go! I'm going to head to the end of the Emerald Trail, to the entrance of Nivla Woods. You should meet me there once you've gotten a little stronger.
[1/1] Aledar: Where are you going? Don't leave us!
[1/1] Tasim: Come over here, we have a problem...
[1/1] Ragni's King: Ah, you must be the last recruit. Please come over here and speak to me.
[1/7] Ragni's King: Hello! Your friends just left. They told me quite the story about what happened to you three on the way here.
[2/7] Ragni's King: Welcome to the Wynn Province!
[3/7] Ragni's King: This is the noble fort of Ragni, one of the oldest and most influential cities in the province!
[4/7] Ragni's King: Your job as a soldier of Wynn is to stop the growth of the monsters that are ravaging the province.
[5/7] Ragni's King: You might want to train a little more before hand, though. Many lives are lost everyday...
[6/7] Ragni's King: ... Anyway, good luck! If you are lost, use map.wynncraft.com as it is very useful if you don't know where to go.
[7/7] Ragni's King: Take this [1 Ragni Teleportation Scroll] too! It will bring you back here if you use it.
[1/5] Enzan: I see you want to venture into the wilderness!
[2/5] Enzan: My name is Enzan, and I am now a retired knight. I've spent most of my life fighting for Ragni's army, just like you.
[3/5] Enzan: I know how hard it must be to be a recruit at this time, so I've got something that could help you! Well, I don't have it, but my brother does!
[4/5] Enzan: Follow this road, he's just past the item identifier, you can't miss him. Just head to the big set of stairs, past the item identifier.
[5/5] Enzan: Tell him I sent you! He can be such a jerk to strangers sometimes, especially when he's focused on his stairs...
[1/2] Enzan: What are you waiting for?
[2/2] Enzan: My brother shouldn't be hard to find, he's obsessed with stairs. He should be near the item identifier.
[1/1] Enzan: Hey there! Still doing well after all this time?
[1/6] Therck: Excuse me? Can't you see I'm busy?
[2/6] Therck: Oh, my brother? Sorry, I didn't know.
[3/6] Therck: Why yes, I actually have something that could help you...
[4/6] Therck: But before I give it to you, why don't you h elp me with something first?
[5/6] Therck: You see, there's a special kind of mushroom that grows in this cave. I hear it has certain... energizing properties.
[6/6] Therck: If you can bring me [1 Energy Mushroom], I'll help you out. Enter the cave down the stairs, and bring me that mushroom!
[1/6] Therck: Ah, you're back! Do you have the mushroom?
[2/6] Therck: Excellent... Now I might finally be able to climb these stairs!
[3/6] Therck: Who knows, maybe there's a treasure or something up there?
[4/6] Therck: Take this ring. It's an accessory item! You can identify it at the nearby Item Identifier.
[5/6] Therck: It's a very good ring for someone starting out like you. There's just one small issue...
[6/6] Therck: To wear it, you must help my friend back in Ragni. He's been pestering me for days about needing help.
[1/7] Therck: Ah, you're back! Do you have the mushroom?
[2/7] Therck: Excellent... Now I might finally be able to climb these stairs!
[3/7] Therck: Who knows, maybe there's a treasure or something up there?
[4/7] Therck: Take this ring. It's an accessory item! You can identify it at the nearby Item Identifier.
[5/7] Therck: It's a very good ring for someone starting out like you. There's just one small issue...
[6/7] Therck: To wear it, you must help my friend back in Ragni. He's been pestering me for days about needing help.
[7/7] Therck: Open your [Quest Book] and Right-Click on Cook Assistant to see if you can help.
[1/2] Therck: Well? Have you brought me [1 Energy Mushroom]?
[2/2] Therck: No? Then what are you waiting for, go back into that cave!
[1/2] Therck: Go on, I don't have time for you. My brother keeps sending me people all the time.
[2/2] Therck: They keep coming expecting free stuff! I don't have time for this, I still need to climb these stairs...
[1/1] Therck: I don't have time to talk to you right now, move along!
[1/5] Farmer Cevalus: Ah, looks like a fresh recruit! Did you see my posting? Good, good.
[2/5] Farmer Cevalus: Recently, my dear step-father passed away and I buried him out back. Well, he's not there anymore... the corruption has got to his body.
[3/5] Farmer Cevalus: Yes, yes, I know, I should have buried him more responsibly... But I didn't, and now he's turned into an unstoppable beast!
[4/5] Farmer Cevalus: We should use my fresh Corkian sprinklers to poison the pest! I have a spare [1 Crate of Rat Poison] here... But I'm too weak to get past the pest myself.
[5/5] Farmer Cevalus: That's where you come in! If you poison the water reservoir on the other side of the farm field after you enter, I'll enable the sprinklers, and he'll be done for!
[1/2] Farmer Cevalus: There we are! Water poisoned, sprinklers enabled... Now we can just watch as he-
[2/2] Farmer Cevalus: Oh, dear. It seems to have just made him angry. Recruit, he's weakened- you'll have to kill him yourself!
[1/1] Farmer Cevalus: You've done it! Come back here now, so I can reward you for your work.
[1/3] Farmer Cevalus: Goodness, that was a little more exciting than I anticipated. Still, good work! I'm glad we were able to get rid of that monster...
[2/3] Farmer Cevalus: I mean... poor step-dad. I don't know how I'll explain this to the wife... Might need to buy her something nice, heh.
[3/3] Farmer Cevalus: Anyhow, take this well-deserved reward for the risky actions you took today. I'll also give you access to my second farm in the back, take whatever you need there!
[1/1] Farmer Cevalus: I thank you greatly for your actions. My crops should grow back soon!
[1/1] Farmer Cevalus: Hey! Get away from my farm, this is private property!
[1/1] Farmer Cevalus: I could really use some help right now, but you are too weak. Come back when you are level 2.
[1/1] Farmer Cevalus: Have you at least attempted to get rid of that pest yet? Remember, the water reservoir is on the other end of this here field.
[1/4] The Cook: I can't believe what is happening to me!
[2/4] The Cook: The King ordered me to bake cakes for all those new recruits!
[3/4] The Cook: Unfortunately I don't have the ingredients to make them, and nobody sells those items in the fort!
[4/4] The Cook: You think you could get me [2 Eggs], [1 Bucket of Milk] and [3 Wheat Grains] really quickly?
[1/3] The Cook: Great! You got all the ingredients!
[2/3] The Cook: I can't thank you enough! Here, take these emeralds and armour for all your trouble.
[3/3] The Cook: You should explore around to become stronger. I hear there might be work to do in Nivla Woods.
[1/2] The Cook: I urgently need help! But you aren't experienced enough to help me, yet.
[2/2] The Cook: Come back as soon as you reach level 3.
[1/4] The Cook: I still need [2 Eggs], [1 Bucket of Milk] and [3 Wheat Grains].
[2/4] The Cook: You can get eggs at the ranch north of Ragni, by killing some chickens.
[3/4] The Cook: You can get milk by buying it from a merchant there as well.
[4/4] The Cook: You can get wheat grains by farming some from the fields close to Ragni's north entrance.
[1/1] The Cook: You should practice your cooking, maybe one day you'll become a master chef like myself!
[1/9] Ope: Oh, man... What am I going to do now...
[2/9] Ope: O-oh! H-hello soldier! Wow, what a coincidence that we're both here... in Detlas... today...
[3/9] Ope: What? Don't look at me like that! We had a perfectly fair interaction which we both benefited from. I got the plant, and you... well. You gained experience?
[4/9] Ope: Look, alright, I get it! But I can't pay you back either way. The mayor sent me here to pick up a crate of supplies for the village.
[5/9] Ope: The issue is... I've already run out of money on- uh, unrelated purchases. And even if I had the money, I couldn't buy the supply crate anyway...
[6/9] Ope: Those two over there who run the market banned me from ever using it after I tried to buy out the world's supplies of magical powders.
[7/9] Ope: Look, it's not my fault I'm making big market moves. I'm just, you know- smarter than all these other folks!
[8/9] Ope: ... The point is. I could really use your help right now! I- I promise, I'll pay you back for it this time.
[9/9] Ope: All you need to do is go over to the Trade Market, and buy the supply crate for me. Please?
[8/10] Ope: ... What? They also banned you from the market?! Well, great. What're we supposed to do now?
[9/10] Ope: Well, do you have any other friends we could get involved? There was... that other soldier guy, right? His name was... Tim. Or something.
[10/10] Ope: Look- alright, I get it, I'm a jerk who doesn't remember peoples' names! Could you just ask him to buy the supplies for us? He's our last hope... probably.
[1/2] Ope: Well? Did you buy the supply crate yet?
[2/2] Ope: All you need to do is go over to the Trade Market, and buy the supply crate for me. It's not that hard!
[1/1] Ope: Hey, good work! Now you'll need to pick up the supply crate.
[1/1] Ope: Perfect! Now, quickly, come back over here, before those two realize you're working with me!
[1/6] Ope: You got the item? Good. Good, good good.
[2/6] Ope: Okay! Now, we're onto step two. So, you see, this package still needs to make it to Alekin Village...
[3/6] Ope: And. Well. You're the one holding the crate, not me! So... you know!
[4/6] Ope: Well, you see. I really don't want to do it. And I'm not going to!
[5/6] Ope: So either you run the supplies to Alekin Village... or we both run away and start new lives, and we avoid the consequences of our actions!
[6/6] Ope: ...no? No. Okay. Worth a shot. Well, you know the way by now! No need for me to, uh, get in your way! Heh...
[4/6] Ope: Great! You know the way by now, surely! No need for me to, uh, get in your way!
[5/6] Ope: Just take those supplies to Alekin Village, and. Well. Things will work out.
[6/6] Ope: ...probably.
[1/1] Tasim: Oh, hey soldier! Are you just here to hang out? Or- that look on your face tells me you're here for something else.
[1/3] Tasim: ...Oh. Well, that explains that. Though- is there a reason you can't get it yourself?
[1/3] Tasim: I... guess so? Is there a reason you can't do it yourself?
[2/3] Tasim: ...You're banned from the market? How did you even manage that? We haven't even been in Detlas for that long!
[3/3] Tasim: You- what!? Nevermind, I don't actually want to know. Come on, lead the way. I'll buy... whatever it is you need.
[3/3] Tasim: Tasim: You- what!? Nevermind, I don't actually want to know. Come on, lead the way. I'll buy whatever it is Ope needs.
[1/2] Tasim: Alright. So I'm just buying a supply crate...
[2/2] Tasim: Here it is. I wish you luck with... whatever it is you're up to.
[1/6] Ope: He bought you the item? Good. Good, good good. Okay! That was... harder than expected.
[2/6] Ope: Now, we're onto step two. So, you see, this package still needs to make it to Alekin Village...
[1/1] Ope: Hey! I- uh, I can't help but notice that. You're still here. With the crate. You need to bring it to Alekin Village, remember?
[1/5] Mayor Alvin: Ah... So you do. I thought I had sent Ope to pick that up...
[2/5] Mayor Alvin: More of his shenanigans, I suppose. I am sorry you have had to deal with him twice.
[3/5] Mayor Alvin: When he returns to the village, I'm going to need to have a word with him... Ah, but of course, I should pay you for your troubles.
[4/5] Mayor Alvin: I hope these emeralds will suffice. Additionally... we have recently fixed up one of our broken carts, which makes the trip to Detlas and back.
[5/5] Mayor Alvin: You may feel free to use it whenever you like! As thanks for all you have done for us.
[1/2] Wagon Driver: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Alekin Village? Sorry to say, but the wagon's broken down.
[1/2] Wagon Driver: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Detlas? Sorry to say, but the wagon's broken down.
[2/2] Wagon Driver: I reckon it won't be long 'till it's fixed up, but you'll have to make the journey yourself for now.
[1/2] Wagon Driver: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Detlas? Well, lucky you! The wagon's been fixed up all nice and new!
[2/2] Wagon Driver: Just hop on aboard, and I'll get you to Detlas in a jiffy!
[1/1] Wagon Driver: Ain't far to Detlas from here! We'll be there in a jiffy, just you wait.
[1/2] Wagon Driver: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Alekin Village? Well, lucky you! The wagon's been fixed up all nice and new!
[2/2] Wagon Driver: Just hop on aboard, and I'll get you to Alekin Village in a jiffy!
[1/1] Wagon Driver: Ain't far to Alekin Village from here! We'll be there in a jiffy, just you wait.
[1/8] Tasim: Oh, soldier! There you are. It's good to see you. Are you ready to continue on towards Detlas?
[2/8] Tasim: It seems we'll need to pass through the Nivla Woods first. I've heard the forest is crawling with spiders... But between you and me, we should be-
[3/8] ???: H-hey! You two! You're soldiers, right? I can tell from your weird fashion sense. You folk are supposed to help people! So. Help!
[4/8] Tasim: Huh? Oh- yes, of course! What's your name? What do you need help with?
[5/8] Ope: I'm Ope! I was recently... uh... bit by a spider! And now I need your help to get a rare medicinal herb to heal me!
[6/8] Ope: It only grows in an infested cave filled with creepy crawlies. And I'm clearly in no condition to go get it myself!
[7/8] Tasim: Well, alright! We're here to help, after all, so... We'll get you that herb!
[8/8] Ope: Perfect. I'll bring you to the cave, and you can do the rest from there. Follow me, soldiers!
[1/4] Ope: Well, here we are! The only way you can reach the cave is up through this tree.
[2/4] Ope: Hm... There's two of you. Good! One of you can climb up into that cave, and the other can protect me from the crawly spiders down here!
[3/4] Tasim: Alright! soldier, you can go up into the tree, and I can defend Ope here while you do that.
[4/4] Ope: Good, good. Well, good luck up there! Try not to get bitten too much by the spiders!
[1/1] Elder Forest Spider: ......must............protect............
[1/10] Ope: There you are! It feels like we've been waiting for hours.
[2/10] Tasim: It... really hasn't been that long. Maybe ten minutes at most.
[3/10] Ope: Well-... Anyway! Do you have the herb? It's very- uh, important! To cure me. Yep.
[4/10] Ope: There it is! Eheh. Thank you kindly for your work, soldiers! Now, about your payment... Let's see, what do I have...
[5/10] Ope: Oh. I seem to be out of emeralds. Well- I can, uh, offer some advice! There's lots to find in this forest. Plenty of caves with valuables to explore! Might be worth your time.
[6/10] Tasim: Wait, are you seriously not going to-

[1/3] Tasim: I guess that's that taken care of. We'll be able to burn through the webs protecting the spiders' nest, now.
[2/3] Tasim: You heard the spider mention a queen, right? We'll probably have to defeat it in its nest to stop the spiders, once and for all.
[3/3] Tasim: We should get going back down the mountain. We don't want to keep Aledar and the Captain waiting.
[1/6] Captain Enduyn: You've returned! I trust you found something that can help us pass through these webs?
[2/6] Aledar: We did! We fought off a spider at the summit, and claimed a magical flame.
[3/6] Captain Enduyn: Excellent! Now, give it here. I take it the three of you intend to storm the nest?
[4/6] Tasim: That's why we're here, yes. We'll deal with this spider problem once and for all.
[5/6] Captain Enduyn: If that's the case, I'll leave it to you. I'll continue dealing with the spiders in this area of the forest in the meantime.
[6/6] Captain Enduyn: ...Anyway, stand clear for a moment! I'm about to burn the webs. Good luck in there!
[2/6] Tasim: We did, yes. There was a powerful spider at the peak, which was making use of this magical flame.
[4/6] Aledar: Yep, we do! The Admiral sent us here with that mission, and we'll do our best to complete it.
[1/2] Captain Enduyn: Here we go!
[2/2] Captain Enduyn: Now head on in and finish off these pests!
[2/2] Aledar: Alright! We'll handle the volcano then. Captain, Tasim, don't die out here!
[2/2] Tasim: Alright. We'll fight through the spiders in the mountain, then. Captain, Aledar, good luck!
[1/3] Captain Enduyn: At ease, soldier! Not much to see here, I'm afraid.
[2/3] Captain Enduyn: I've been stationed here to keep an eye on the spiders' nest, but... Well, they've put up a massive web to block entry! There's no way through, from what I can tell.
[3/3] Captain Enduyn: If you'd like to help, I'd suggest speaking to Admiral Aegis in Detlas. He'll be able to give you an assignment.
[1/7] Thomas: Oh, finally, someone has come to this hidden village!
[2/7] Thomas: I am Thomas, and I help manage the supplies for this ravine village.  Though, I have  a bit of a problem...
[3/7] Thomas: We're running low on ravine grains, which is our main staple we use for our food.
[4/7] Thomas: We usually get it ourselves, but recently an angry group of pigmen took over the tunnel to the top of the ravine, where the grain grows.
[5/7] Thomas: The last time we entered, I heard an explosion from the top. I fear the pigmen are blowing up our g rain supply with TNT...
[6/7] Thomas: You appear to be much stronger than I am, so maybe you can get past the tunnel pigmen and eliminate the explosions at the top.
[7/7] Thomas: Just keep to the right wall of the ravine and climb up the stairs to reach the entrance. Also, be careful in the tunnel, as the pigmen throw rocks as a weapon.
[1/10] Thomas: I didn't expect you to fall out of the sky like that. Are you okay, or should I go get the potion mer chant to heal you?
[2/10] Thomas: You're fine? Oh, good  to hear.  Did you manage to get rid of the pigmen and their explosives?
[3/10] Thomas: A green creature? A "creeper"?  No such thing exists in this world, especially with the pigmen all around!
[4/10] Thomas: Oh, you brought a piece of skin back. How odd, I've seen this skin before...
[5/10] Thomas: There's a large cave over to the south. I tried to enter it, but I got ambushed by green creatures...
[6/10] Thomas: I thought I was just dreaming, but these "creepers" you talk about...they might live in that cave.
[7/10] Thomas: I have an idea.  I need to know for sure that they live there. A merchant can make you a mask with the skin and another material.
[8/10] Thomas: There's a Pigman Overlord that sometimes hangs in a cave nearby. If you can kill it, you can get a pigman hide strong enough to make the mask.
[9/10] Thomas: If you continue on the western path past the tunnel entrance, you should find a camp where the Overlord is located.
[10/10] Thomas: Go get the pigman hide, and then come back to me so I can tell you what to do next.
[1/6] Thomas: I see you have the hide. This skin will work perfectly for my plan.
[2/6] Thomas: There is a Mask Merchant in this village. He can make you a mask with the two materials I have.
[3/6] Thomas: With the mask, you can put it on and go undetected into the cave with these "creepers". Only then will we know the truth.
[4/6] Thomas: To get to the creeper cave, follow the western path and turn left at the pigman camps.
[5/6] Thomas: Also, if you somehow lose the mask, the merchant can make you another one if you bring him another piece of skin and hide.
[6/6] Thomas: Here are the materials. Be careful out there. Who knows what those green monsters could do to you...
[1/7] Thomas: So, what was in the cave? Were there really creepers in there?
[2/7] Thomas: What's this? It smells like gunpowder...but more earthy. And this came from the cave?
[3/7] Thomas: This powder is definitely not native to this area. It has to have come from those creepers.
[4/7] Thomas: I guess for now we'll leave them at peace. If they do exist, they don't need to be hunted down to extinction.
[5/7] Thomas: Besides, if they are composed of gunpowder, they could easily blow this ravine to pieces.
[6/7] Thomas: Thank you for your help. I guess you deserve some sort of reward, considering you helped solve the ravine's big mystery.
[7/7] Thomas: Feel free to come back to our village any time. By then our food supply should be stable.
[1/1] Thomas: Our village needs a bit of help, but you look a bit weak for the job. Come back once you're level 15, and then you might be able to help.
[1/1] Thomas: I see you've come back, but you don't have what I asked for. I can't do anything until you fulfill your task.
[1/1] Thomas: Thanks again for your help. Now we can truly say creepers exist here in the ravines.
[1/7] Thomas: Anyone! Can anyone- oh, hello. You look strong enough to be able to help me.
[2/7] Thomas: I am Thomas, and I help manage the supplies for a village in the Pigman Ravine. Though, I have a bit of a problem...
[5/7] Thomas: I came here to Tempo Town to see if I could find help here, but I've had no luck. Until now, that is. Would you be willing to help?
[6/7] Thomas: You would? You're a life saver. I'll meet you at the village, just follow the path out of town and take the northern-most entrance to the ravines.
[7/7] Thomas: Once you get there, keep to the right wall of the ravine and climb up the stairs to reach the entrance. Also, be careful in the tunnel, as the pigmen throw rocks as a weapon.
[1/2] Thomas: I'll meet you at the village! Just follow the path out of town and take the northern-most entrance to the ravines.
[2/2] Thomas: Once you get there, keep to the right wall of the ravine and climb up the stairs to reach the entrance. Also, be careful in the tunnel, as the pigmen throw rocks as a weapon.
[1/1] Thomas: Do you need a reminder about the location of the Pigman Overlord? Just continue on the western path past the tunnel entrance, and you should find a camp where the Overlord is located.
[1/1] Thomas: Have you been to the creeper cave? Just follow the western path and turn left at the pigman camps.
[1/4] Rynend: Please help us! We called for a Ragni guard days ago, but Humans tend to forget this little village.
[2/4] Rynend: Last week, an evil witch found refuge in our old well. Normally this wouldn't be a problem...
[3/4] Rynend: But she's lured my child into the well! My only child! He was born in Wynn, that makes him a Wynn citizen!
[4/4] Rynend: Please do something! I know Maltic isn't of importance to you humans, being a Villager settlement, but...my son!
[1/1] Child: Help me! Someone! The witch is being mean!!
[1/1] Witch: I wondered when they'd send the famous Ragni guards. You'll never get me!
[1/2] Witch: I don't know why they call me a witch. Magic is everywhere, you know. This one's father made fun of my looks, so I'll turn his son into a Grook!
[2/2] Witch: Treat me like a witch, I'll act like one, darn it! You'll have to pass through my dastardly magical defenses to find me!
[1/2] Witch: Oh...drat. I never could get that spell right. Well, now you'll have to guess the way, um, you fool! Turn back now, for, uh...
[2/2] Witch: ...for if you choose the wrong door, you'll be sent to a beast, a beast most foul! The, um...the Beast-What-Eats-Ragni-Guards-For-Brunch!! Totally!
[1/4] Witch: Oh...didn't think that'd fool you. You know, I'm really not all that good at magic. I just like wearing pointy hats, and have warts.
[2/4] Witch: Maybe if the people of this village weren't so mean to me, I wouldn't have been forced to live here.
[3/4] Witch: I know it's a crime, but his father and the rest of the villagers here hunt me like I'm a rabid dog!
[4/4] Witch: I wasn't really going to turn this boy into a Grook. I doubt I could even make him grow one feather. I mean, watch...
[1/1] Child: Thank you for saving me from the witch... She was nice at first and made me cookies, but I want to go home now.
[1/3] Rynend: Oh my son! What happened down there? Erh, not a witch, you say?
[2/3] Rynend: Preposterous! She wore a hat and had warts! I guess it's too late now... Thank you so much for your help.
[3/3] Rynend: Please take this [1 Maltic Recommendation Letter], I am sure it will help you someday!
[1/1] Rynend: Come back to me when you're level 16, we need a strong hero to help our town!
[1/1] Rynend: Please save my son! Bring me proof of the dead witch too.
[1/1] Rynend: I cannot thank you enough for your help!
[1/6] Colonel Gailard: Oh, good, good! I bet'cha you're a Ragni soldier, aren't ya? Listen up, soldier! I've got a task here that 'ye can help out with.
[2/6] Colonel Gailard: Ya see that lava spring right there? It just went and popped up out of nowhere! The brass is real concerned about it, mhm?
[3/6] Colonel Gailard: They've been yappin' about it bein' related to the Corruption, and 'ye can bet that that means trouble. BAD trouble.
[4/6] Colonel Gailard: Now, this here Savannah has always had some Corruption lurkin' about, but not to the point where it can do this! It won't be safe around here if we don't do somethin' about it!
[5/6] Colonel Gailard: Anyways, high command ain't gonna provide support for this until they know there's actual Corruption, so we've gotta find some evidence around the springs, understand?
[6/6] Colonel Gailard: Take a look around the springs, soldier! Find me some damn evidence around here! [3 Pieces of Evidence] should be enough! Now, get movin'!
[1/8] Colonel Gailard: Alright, good! Ya found some evidence, let me take a look at that!
[2/8] Colonel Gailard: Oh... This is bad... very, VERY bad...
[3/8] Colonel Gailard: This here is some physical corruption. If it's gettin' onto the surface, then 'ye can bet one of those weeds is spreadin' underground, right beneath the springs...
[4/8] Colonel Gailard: If ya could get underneath the spring, 'ye could probably sever whatever damn root is causing this, but... the heat would be sure to fry your skin off...
[5/8] Colonel Gailard: Wait... I've got an idea... Alright, listen up soldier! There's a lil' town North of here named Bremminglar, yeah? There's a healer person there that can help us out.
[6/8] Colonel Gailard: They're holed up inside of some important well in the center of the town. There's a password ya need to hop into that place, though...
[7/8] Colonel Gailard: Don't have much to go on, but I'm pretty damn sure the password is Bob, or something. After the hero himself.
[8/8] Colonel Gailard: Right, ye're headin' there to find a potion that can keep ya weak little hide safe from the heat, understand? Here, let me write down the location in that book of yours.
[1/4] Gregor: Hey, hey hey hey! Darling, what do you think you're doing? You can't just waltz in here without telling me the password!
[2/4] Gregor: Hmm... Your face... confidence... it gleans with confidence... yet... you still haven't spoken to me since you arrived...
[3/4] Gregor: Could it be... you know that the password is penguin eggs, but you're just too shy to talk? Yeah... yeah, that's gotta be it!
[4/4] Gregor: You've convinced me, little mute darling... You can enter the well. Go on, now!
[1/2] Gregor: Right, listen here darling... There's a secret to this well... it's that... there's a guy doing his job down there... spooky, right??
[2/2] Gregor: So... be a nice, respectful person, and don't go goofing off around here, yes?
[1/1] Gregor: Hey! Stay out of there, nosey guy! I don't remember you giving me a password, darling!
[1/8] Nami The Healer: G'day to you, friend. How can I help you?
[2/8] Nami The Healer: Hm? The Colonel sent you? what for?
[3/8] Nami The Healer: ...Corrupted... lava springs...? You realize how stupid that sounds, yeah? Well, I completely believe you.
[4/8] Nami The Healer: Right, you said lava, sooo... You need a heat resistance potion, yes?
[5/8] Nami The Healer: Welp, you're in luck, kinda... I have a potion that can resist the heat of lava, but the brew will not let you swim in lava.
[6/8] Nami The Healer: Oh that works, you just need to enter a borehole that goes through the lava? Perfect
[7/8] Nami The Healer: Anyways, if you ever need any more special brews, my assistant will be happy to sell some at a very affordable price.
[8/8] Nami The Healer: Now, you have somewhere to be, right? Right. Go and report back to the Colonel, soldier. Tell him I said hi, by the way.
[1/6] Colonel Gailard: Report! Ya got the potion yet, soldier? Good, drink it if ya haven't already!
[2/6] Colonel Gailard: Right, that's what I like to hear! Now, LOOK TO THE LEFT SOLDIER! There is a borehole out there we dug to try and hit the source of this weed.
[3/6] Colonel Gailard: We found a pretty damn hot cave lying underneath the surface! If ya jumped into the borehole, 'ye could probably find the source of the Corruption and stop it.
[4/6] Colonel Gailard: Now, the roots and spikes of Corruption are very sturdy, but we ain't never seen something like lava burstin' out of the ground.
[5/6] Colonel Gailard: Had a small chat with the brass, earlier. They got a hunch that there's a heart to the Corruption that's pumpin' out all the lava!
[6/6] Colonel Gailard: That's gotta be our ticket, yeah? If 'ye destroy that, ya should be able to stop the spread of the lava! Now, get movin'! Head into the borehole, soldier!
[1/1] Colonel Gailard: Hah! I knew ya'd give me results! Ye're pretty damn reliable, soldier! Here, take this for your trouble!
[1/8] Sayleros: You sure look like a strong adventurer who could help me!
[2/8] Sayleros: My name is Sayleros. I spent most of my life in Nemract, but decided to come live in Detlas with my family a few weeks ago.
[3/8] Sayleros: However, we got attacked by thieves on our way here, and I had to leave my family behind. Most of them died, unfortunately.
[4/8] Sayleros: I know that my brother had his will on him during the attack. Knowing he was a rich fellow, I expect to be receving a large part of his fortune.
[5/8] Sayleros: His body is buried somewhere in Nemract. I own a large graveyard there, and can grant you access to it if you can bring me back his will.
[6/8] Sayleros: One of my other brothers also survived the attack. He isn't... um... somebody I'd trust greatly, but I'm sure he has some useful informations for you.
[7/8] Sayleros: His name is Drucksh. He usually likes to talk a lot when he is drunk, see if you can do anything with that.
[8/8] Sayleros: I'll be waiting for your return! Follow this path, it leads directly to Nemract. Good Luck!
[1/2] Drucksh: Mmh. g... uh! oh, why hello there.
[2/2] Drucksh: My brother? Oh yes, I do know where he is "buried", but do I want to tell you? No, It's none of your business.
[1/4] Drucksh: Ohh mmhhhgg... g-g-good old Nemract whiskey!
[2/4] Drucksh: F-fine! I guess it wouldn't h-h-hurt to tell...*burp*..you where it-it- he is...
[3/4] Drucksh: It's in the old c-c-cathedral, at the end of the town. Walk east, it should be right after the b-b-bridge.
[4/4] Drucksh: Though, the p-p-priest might not let you go in that easily...
[1/4] The Priest: Are you trying to go down into the crypt? Oh, that is a very bad idea.
[2/4] The Priest: This place has been corrupted, and the dead came back to life. We had to break the stairs to protect this cathedral.
[3/4] The Priest: If you really want to enter it, I'd have to purify it so it doesn't corrupt you.
[4/4] The Priest: Bring me [12 Rotten Flesh], that should do it. Ancient Nemract is filled with zombies, it's toward the south-west.
[1/2] The Priest: You got the flesh. Good.
[2/2] The Priest: It should be... "safe", now. Be very careful, you are entering at your own risk.
[1/1] Sayleros: You look like you desperately need an adventure, Come back when you're level 20, I might need you.
[1/1] Sayleros: Thank you so much for your help!
[1/6] Sayleros: soldier, there you are! You were taking so long, so I came over here as quickly as I could, in case you needed my help.
[2/6] Sayleros: What? You got his will already? That- that's brilliant! Here, let me take a look.
[3/6] Sayleros: Well, it's a little dusty, but I think it'll do the trick! Thank you greatly for the help.
[4/6] Sayleros: Here, here, take these as proof of my gratitude. And, also- Priest, since you're here, I'd like to grant soldier here access to the graveyard.
[5/6] Priest: Very well. It shall be done.
[6/6] Sayleros: Excellent. Well, I'll be off to Detlas now. Feel free to visit if you'd like!
[1/1] The Priest: Thank the gods you are still alive! Hopefully you are still doing fine in this dangerous world?
[1/5] Mask Salesman: Hmm... Let's see, wha- Ah! Oh, pardon me, I was distracted. Luckily you're here, because I require some assistance.
[2/5] Mask Salesman: You see, I was just on my way back from that large mansion near Nesaak, where I went to acquire some antiques from an old business partner.
[3/5] Mask Salesman: However, along the way, a valuable cursed mask escaped from my caravan and somehow made its way into the dark mine over there!
[4/5] Mask Salesman: I would've gone after it, but the things I have in this caravan are too important to leave by themselves. Not to mention that the cave seemed to corrupt from the inside out...
[5/5] Mask Salesman: You must help me retrieve the mask, for I must depart in 3 days! Could you brave the shadowy cave and bring it back?
[1/4] Mask Salesman: You've met a terrible fate, haven't you? I was just about to run the whole way to Nemract to get help.
[2/4] Mask Salesman: I would really like to hear what you encountered in that cave, but I must prepare to leave, for I have many masks to sell on a far away continent.
[3/4] Mask Salesman: Maybe you can visit me at some point, if our paths were to ever cross again. Then we could talk about your journey.
[4/4] Mask Salesman: To thank you for your help, I wanted to give you a special mask, but I'm out of it. Maybe next year?
[1/1] Mask Salesman: If you ever need something in the future, you should visit me in my homeland.

[1/1] Mask Salesman: I can't talk right now. I've lost something rather valuable, and I need to get it back quickly, because I'm only staying here for a couple of weeks. Please come back when you're level 21.
[1/1] Mask Salesman: Please help me find that mask! It's very valuable.
[1/6] Viraex: Garoth? Sorry that name doesn't ring a bell. He could have lived here, but...
[2/6] Viraex: The buildings here have been destroyed and rebuilt so many times.
[3/6] Viraex: If you say he lived here many years ago, the oldest building is the church.
[4/6] Viraex: Now that you mention it, there were odd stories about the basement of the church.
[5/6] Viraex: My grandfather told me about it. I still have a key to the place, you are welcome to check it out for yourself.
[6/6] Viraex: I heard they found some weird rooms down there so they just left the place alone. Wise move, if you ask me.
[1/10] Garoth's Journal: Day 4: The year is 623 AP. My base of operations has been completed, along with a safety bunker.
[2/10] Garoth's Journal: Day 18: It's become extremely dangerous to continue my studies. With the Twains gone, the corrupt run wild.
[3/10] Garoth's Journal: Day 53: My studies have yielded poor results. I know only what we already knew.
[4/10] Garoth's Journal: That simple creatures become enraged and corrupt, the fallen both old and new will rise near corruption.
[5/10] Garoth's Journal: Day 91: My studies have hit a wall. I know from my extended stay that humans will not corrupt through proximity or touch.
[6/10] Garoth's Journal: The corruption seems to affect everything differently. Land, animal, human, mind. It's incomprehensible.
[7/10] Garoth's Journal: Day 147: I fear there is nothing else to do but study the portal entrance for myself.
[8/10] Garoth's Journal: If there is a "cure" I'm sure it will have something to do with understanding the portal.
[9/10] Garoth's Journal: I leave this journal in the hopes that it will be found and help those understand this plight better than I. Though I admit, my information is not helpful.
[10/10] Garoth's Journal: The corruption acts independently and without intelligence. It does not think, it simply does. It's like an idea, a concept. An idea is something that can not be destroyed.
[1/3] Adventuring Mage: What business does a Ragni soldier have here? These are restricted grounds!
[2/3] Adventuring Mage: Finding Garoth's old camp? Yes, it's been said to be around here, but it's old, and the entrance has probably fallen apart.
[3/3] Adventuring Mage: How about you look around here, it should be very near, and when you have found it, I'll help you open it!
[1/8] Adventuring Mage: *Mumbling* ... Hey what are you doing here! This is off limits!
[2/8] Adventuring Mage: Right, finding Garoth's old camp...
[3/8] Adventuring Mage: You say the blocked off entrance is over there?
[4/8] Adventuring Mage: I doubt you'd be able to move it with any spell you know.
[5/8] Adventuring Mage: Well, allow me to assist.
[6/8] Adventuring Mage: The spells around here have to be a bit stronger to deal with the... Well, you know.
[7/8] Adventuring Mage: Wait for it...
[8/8] Adventuring Mage: And there you go. I hope you find what youre looking for. Get out of here as soon as youre done.
[1/1] Adventuring Mage: Walk inside then, soldier! What are you standing around here for?
[1/4] Garoth's Note: This... was a mistake. Beyond the portal holds no answers.
[2/4] Garoth's Note: I can feel my mind slipping through my very mindscape, I fear this may be my very last entry.
[3/4] Garoth's Note: As I studied the portal closely, I found myself staring for hours, longing to enter. Just as I forced myself to leave.. I was pushed.
[1/6] Pottur: Stop, Stop, Stop!
[2/6] Pottur: This isn't working. Great, now a Ragni soldier is here for a progress report.
[3/6] Pottur: Soldier, we haven't made any progress getting to Garoth.
[4/6] Pottur: Truth is, we simply don't know enough about him to know how to deal with this.
[5/6] Pottur: Maybe if you could help us find out more we could figure this out.
[6/6] Pottur: Garoth, many years ago lived and studied in Elkurn. It might be a good place to start.
[1/5] Pottur: Welcome back soldier. Still no luck here I'm afraid. Did you find out anything about Garoth's past?
[2/5] Pottur: ... I see. We had no idea he was corrupted. We didn't even consider that for a second!
[3/5] Pottur: Well if that's the case it might just be a simple case of...
[4/5] Pottur: Success!
[5/5] Pottur: I can't believe it was that simple. Magic can be like forcing a square into a circle, you just got to change your tact. Thanks for your help soldier.
[1/1] Merloni: Ah yes, hello! I don't think you want to hear what I have to say. It's a bit out of your league, come back when you are level 23.
[1/8] Merloni: Would you like to hear the tale of the pit of the dead?
[2/8] Merloni: It is the pit where the corpses of the poor miners who discovered what is now named the Nether Portal are buried.
[3/8] Merloni: Those that had not already died had to be executed due to the insanity brought on from the corruption.
[4/8] Merloni: Their spirits still haunt the grave and infect the minds of people who disturb them. It isn't pretty.
[5/8] Merloni: However, I heard rumours of those who were able to bathe in their waters and be accepted by them, to show no fear of the dead is to be admired.
[6/8] Merloni: Maybe this shrine that I keep hearing about has something to do with it? It's apparently hidden deep inside the pit.
[7/8] Merloni: Soldier, the pit is located south east of Nemract, across the bridge behind us. I will write down the coordinates inside your content book.
[8/8] Merloni: Enter the pit. Learn it's mysteries, then come back to me.
[1/1] Merloni: If you are too scared to go down there, I understand. Dealing with the souls of the dead isn't for everyone.
[1/1] Merloni: Very impressive! Here's your reward. I found it a while ago while walking around Nemract. It probably fell off a skeleton!
[1/1] Merloni: Glad to see you again!
[1/6] Nohno: Hey, you aren't a chicken! Wait, you're a human! You can help me! Maybe you are the guy who helped my brother Yahya, but who knows, you humans all look the same to me.
[2/6] Nohno: I really love my chickens, but there is one that I just cannot control...
[3/6] Nohno: His name is Cluckles, he was given to me by a man named Bob before he went to war, but when Bob never came back, Cluckles got angry...
[4/6] Nohno: He's really dangerous to keep on my lovely island, so I keep him in my basement...
[5/6] Nohno: I want to take care of him, but my wife says it's too dangerous. Where's my wife you say? Oh, I think she's around here eating some grain.
[6/6] Nohno: Anyway, I need you to go down there and... take care of him for me. I would really appreciate it.
[1/2] Nohno: What is this?! His feather? What did you do to Cluckles?!  I wanted you to take care of him, not kill him!
[2/2] Nohno: You monster! Leave this place now, and keep that feather to remind you of your hideous crime!
[1/10] Leucsaa: Let's see here... mother's old vase check!
[2/10] Leucsaa: Dining room table... got it here, check!
[3/10] Leucsaa: Finally, the journal. It's out here somewhere, I assume. I'll look around.
[5/10] Leucsaa: Hold on, what? The journal! I must have forgotten it inside the mansion!
[6/10] Leucsaa: You there! Would you mind doing me a deed?
[7/10] Leucsaa: I left a very precious journal inside of this mansion, a hell within walls. It was my great grandfather's!
[8/10] Leucsaa: The mansion was designed by a Corkian architect, and I was scammed into buying it.
[9/10] Leucsaa: If you step inside the mansion just for a few moments, you'll understand why the sellers had to trick someone into investing in their god forsaken real estate!

[2/4] Honip: You took care of these damn thieving rodents? A... colossal rat you say?

[4/4] Honip: Anyways, come talk to me

[5/7] Honip: That's why we're not too fond of goin' in... But our gunpowder there! We need it, as pirates!

[7/7] Honip: Don't be as bad as earlier. You're a soldier.

[1/5] Honip: ...Seth? Have ya seen the soldier?

[1/1] Seaskipper Captain: 'ey there soldier! Looks like ya're in a bit of a pickle! How 'bout ya hop on?'
[1/7] Seaskipper Captain: Well... We're headed for Selchar, the heart of the ocean! Which is safer than wherever you were, heh!
[1/1] Honip: Soldier, now's your time to shine! Scare it off with one of your spells or somethin'!
[1/1] Honip: It's working! Do that again!
[1/1] Honip: One more...
[4/4] Honip: Anyway, come talk to me.
[1/9] Tom: Finally, you have arrived! I have been waiting for you.
[2/9] Tom: It's so good to see you again! Wait, we haven't met yet, of course!
[3/9] Tom: Sorry, where are my manners? My name is Tom, I have been living here in Selchar for 30 years.

[4/9] Tom: I can't really explain why or how I know, but you are destined to help us, so I implore you to hear my tale. Santa is a real man who delivers presents all over the three provinces. However, he hasn't been seen in Selchar ever since it was founded.
[5/9] Tom: There's a reason for it too, it's not because the children were naughty or anything like that.
[6/9] Tom: This is a lot to ask, but will you investigate this crisis? People of Selchar will be very thankful.
[7/9] Tom: You can start by searching for Santa, I believe he relocated to the top of an isolated icy island village after an incident the other year.
[8/9] Tom: I am not sure where, but some travelling merchants had mentioned about an island with candycanes east from here.
[9/9] Tom: Good luck! The people of Selchar will be counting on you, I- I'm sure we will see each other soon. Or rather, you'll be seeing me at any rate.
[1/9] Santa: Ho ho ho! Merry Craftmas! Well not exactly, but its only a couple of days left!
[2/9] Santa: So what can I help you with, young traveller? You have to wait until Craftmas for your presents, ho ho ho!
[3/9] Santa: Ho? Selchar? Oh yes indeed, Selchar, that poor little island. I wonder if those people there are alright.
[4/9] Santa: You see, I was never able to enter that city because of the corrupted magic surrounding the island.
[5/9] Santa: My reindeer are very sensitive to evil auras, they will not fly anywhere nearby anything that seems... dark, or twisted.
[6/9] Santa: Hey, I have an idea! Why don't you use my portal to go to the past and investigate for me? I feel terrible for an entire city missing 30 years worth of presents.
[7/9] Santa: I wish I could accompany you, but its only a couple of days left to Craftmas and I still have a lot of presents to manage, ho ho!
[8/9] Santa: Don't worry! The portal might be a chimney, but I have been doing this before you were even born! Ho ho ho!
[9/9] Santa: Ho ho ho! That's the craftmas spirit I want to see! Simply walk into the fire and off you go! Good luck and be careful in the past, changing things can be very dangerous!
[1/8] Tommy: Wendy, where are you? Heheheheh! Oh, hi! You seem new to this place.
[2/8] Tommy: The name is Tommy and I'm ten! I am always excited to meet new people that come to town! Someday this town will be very lively and fun!
[3/8] Tommy: So what are you doing here? Want to join me play hide and seek with Wendy?
[4/8] Tommy: Magical barrier? I don't think anybody here will know what you are looking for. Nobody here really knows magic sadly.
[5/8] Tommy: I did see a group of shady guys who arrived here last week.
[6/8] Tommy: They always wear these black scary robes and talk about crystals and stuff. I think they might be bad people.
[7/8] Tommy: I followed them once before, they seem to hide in the abandoned cave underneath this island my daddy calls "the heart of Selchar".
[8/8] Tommy: They could be the ones you are looking for. The cave's entrance is just below the stairs nearby. Bye for now, I gotta find Wendy!
[1/1] Summoner: So a little rat finally finds out about our secret, huh. Doesn't matter, with this relicstone, I am going to kill you right here and right now!
[1/4] Summoner: Uaaaggh! How dare you do this to me!
[2/4] Summoner: I can't believe my relic stone can be shattered by some random peasant like you!
[3/4] Summoner: Ugh! Stop it! Alright, you win. We only had the one crystal anyway.
[4/4] Summoner: What? You want to escape this cave? Use the exit portal behind me then, heh heh.
[1/13] Old Tom: Oh no, please! Don't kill me! Wait a minute, it's you! I can't believe it, it's you!
[2/13] Old Tom: Don't you remember me? It's me, Tom! We met when I was 10! That was 60 years ago! Why, you haven't aged a day!
[3/13] Old Tom: You might have already noticed, but Selchar is basically nothing but ashes now. You might not believe me, but the culprit is my old idol, Santa.
[4/13] Old Tom: He just appeared with red eyes and turned the whole island into what you see now.
[5/13] Old Tom: He destroyed building after building, and his elves started to appear from the sky and killed every citizen in sight.
[6/13] Old Tom: Their bodies were full of crimson crystals and their eyes were empty, as if they were possessed by something.
[7/13] Old Tom: I refuse to leave because Selchar is my home. It always has been!
[8/13] Old Tom: Despite what Santa has done, I know he is not like this. The Santa that I knew was kind and always tried bring a smile to everybody's face.
[9/13] Old Tom: That crystal, the one we talked about 60 years ago, I think it did this. But I don't know how Santa got a hold of it. I saw you remove it all those years ago!
[10/13] Old Tom: Santa would never want any of this to happen. This is why, I want you to do something for me, and for him.
[11/13] Old Tom: Please, end Santa's misery from the corruption that cursed him. He must be suffering inside his twisted body right now.
[12/13] Old Tom: Santa made a hideout in the heart of Selchar. I'm sure you can find it by looking for the one with the most crystals.
[13/13] Old Tom: Good luck, hero! I know its hard to do this, but please stop Santa and bring me back [Ragged Santa Cloth] as proof!
[1/8] Old Tom: Did you do it? Santa is dead? Oh no, I can't believe it. He is gone, just like that. After nearly 20 or so years of torment...
[2/8] Old Tom: Sorry, it's just very sad for me to hear the news, despite my being the one who asked for it.
[3/8] Old Tom: Thank you very much, my hero. I will spread the news that Selchar is safe from corruption for now. Maybe once the grass starts to return...
[4/8] Old Tom: You really remind me of the hero in the tales, who journeys through time and the entire province to bring peace.
[5/8] Old Tom: Oh, yes! I am not sure why, but I heard some magical sound from the hourglass tower. It probably happened when you defeated Santa.
[6/8] Old Tom: I reckon it's your way home. Go on now, you wouldn't want to be stuck in this miserable city, would you?
[7/8] Old Tom: I hope you will live a very wonderful life, you deserve it. I hope we can meet again someday.
[8/8] Old Tom: Oh, and keep this crystal shard from the rag you gave me. I definitely don't want it.
[1/9] Santa: Ho ho ho! Well If it isn't my friend who just took a journey through time!
[2/9] Santa: But of course, I already know you were successful, Selchar has had presents for the last 30 years thanks to you!
[3/9] Santa: Although, I would have expected you sooner! I saw something strange and dark in the fire when I expected you to return.
[4/9] Santa: Of course, no one in Selchar will know you saved Craftmas, because for them, no one has missed one! Of course I remember what you did, power of Christmas and all, ho.

[5/9] Santa: So, what took you? Oh, 60 years you say? I wonder how that happened. Well, not even I can claim to know the future. My guess is having that dark crystal with you while travelling in time caused you to over shoot.

[6/9] Santa: Don't tell anyone what you saw though, knowing the future can be dangerous. Ho ho! If this journey has taught us anything, it's that time is a confusing thing, and nothing is set in stone. I don't like to mess around with it too much.
[7/9] Santa: Anyway, I wouldn't want you to keep the crystal with you forever if its truly as powerful as it seems, give it to me, and I'll store it safely.
[8/9] Santa: That is some seriously dark magic we've encountered on this journey, and I'm sure it won't be the last encounter in your adventure.
[9/9] Santa: Here, take this early Craftmas present from me. Good luck with your journey!
[1/1] Mylo: These are dark times, weary traveler! Too dark for you. Come back when you are at least level 30.
[1/1] Mylo: Your deeds bring me great relief! Thank you, my friend.
[1/8] Mylo: These are dark times, weary traveler! Nemract is at its weakest!
[2/8] Mylo: Our warriors have been massacred! We are completely defenceless!
[3/8] Mylo: We once had a brave commander who lead us to victory, but I fear he has turned!
[4/8] Mylo: He is the reason our warriors are dead! He led them into a trap, I'm sure of it!
[5/8] Mylo: His name is Takan. He's been acting strange ever since his brother was sentenced to death by Admiral Amerigo.
[6/8] Mylo: Sadly, I can't prove of his treachery. I desperately need your help! You must investigate further!
[7/8] Mylo: Go talk to Admiral Amerigo in Almuj. Ask him about Takan, then ask him for reinforcements immediately!
[8/8] Mylo: What!? You don't know how to reach Almuj? Just venture past Saint's Row and through the savannah!
[1/10] Amerigo: I have no time for you, stranger! Almuj's army is in panic!
[2/10] Amerigo: You are here for Takan? In Bob's name, of course he's a traitor!
[3/10] Amerigo: You came too late, he has already caused us much trouble!
[4/10] Amerigo: After leaving Nemract, he came to Almuj's barracks and led a surprise attack of bandits! The carnage!
[5/10] Amerigo: I was just about to lead the rest of my army to retaliate, but perhaps there is a better way.
[6/10] Amerigo: Since it would seem that Nemract needs my army, I need you to take care of Takan. Who knows what he could be up to!
[7/10] Amerigo: However, the bandits that have taken over the barracks will be too strong for you! You must use stealth instead of force.
[8/10] Amerigo: Go to the barracks in the corner of the desert and assassinate Commander Takan. Bring me his badge!
[9/10] Amerigo: There should be a way to sneak in from a hole blasted on the far west side of the barracks that I escaped from.
[10/10] Amerigo: In fact, the trail of blood I left behind might lead you to him! You should be able to find him in the command room.
[1/3] Takan: The commanding officers are aristocrats, all of them! They deserve to suffer for their selfishness!
[2/3] Takan: Now that we have taken over their barracks, we can take over all of Wynn and make them suffer!
[3/3] Takan: Today is the dawn of a new era... GAAHHH!
[1/9] Amerigo: Stranger, report!
[2/9] Amerigo: You... You did it?! That was rather fast, I must say!
[3/9] Amerigo: You have done this city proud, stranger. Almuj stands for another day then.
[4/9] Amerigo: Please take this small reward as a token of the city's appreciation... Hm...
[5/9] Amerigo: No, not a small reward. I will give you something that one such as yourself more than deserves.
[6/9] Amerigo: This is not any mere piece of gear. This is spoken of in fantasies, in fables.
[7/9] Amerigo: Such items have special abilities that are far beyond any of the normal magic powers you find on most things.
[8/9] Amerigo: This one, in particular is only awarded in very certain cases, and can be considered a medal of honour. Be proud!
[9/9] Amerigo: Now run along, I have to collect my own honorary badge for taking out Ex-Commander Takan.
[1/1] Amerigo: I have no time for you, stranger! Run along.
[1/1] Amerigo: I need you to assassinate Commander Takan! Hurry stranger!
[1/1] Amerigo: Keep that bracelet around! I am certain you will find it useful.
[1/9] Eluzterp: Oh, hey! You, adventurer over there! Would you mind helping me?
[2/9] Eluzterp: You see, this cave behind me has been troubling me for the past while now.
[3/9] Eluzterp: There are special slimes that live in there, and they drop a certain goo that is quite a delicacy when brewed into a drink!
[4/9] Eluzterp: They are called Gooey Slimes, and should be at the very back. A friend of mine drinks the stuff like water, and he refuses to work without it.
[5/9] Eluzterp: However, the slimes have gotten stronger about a month ago. I'm unable to retrieve it any more, I've come close to getting killed a few times!
[6/9] Eluzterp: You, however, seem much better equipped than I. Hopefully you can do it.
[7/9] Eluzterp: If you decide to help me, you'll need to obtain a special device for retrieving it, as the slime will dry up quickly in the air.
[8/9] Eluzterp: A... less fickle glassblower, Yodbon, can make it for you. He should be living in a house in front of the Almuj bank.
[9/9] Eluzterp: I'll need [8 Slimey Goo] since we'll need a big batch of drinks. If you help, I'll be sure to tell him, and he'll probably let you into his shop.
[1/6] Yodbon: Welcome to Yodbon's Glass Blowery, what can I do f-
[2/6] Yodbon: Oh, another stinkin' adventurer, eh...
[3/6] Yodbon: So many've been coming up to me recently, askin' for a bloody Slime Scooper...
[4/6] Yodbon: Izzat brother o' mine stopped workin' again? I swear, he's addicted to that slop...
[5/6] Yodbon: Anyways, for me to make you a scooper you'll need to get [5 Soft Sand].
[6/6] Yodbon: Come back to me once you've gotten ahold of it. You can dig it up from those sand piles 'round the desert.
[1/3] Yodbon: You've returned, I see.
[2/3] Yodbon: A'ight, fork 'em over and I'll make you the scooper.
[3/3] Yodbon: ...There you go. No idea why he wants that stuff though. Maybe it's an acquired taste...
[1/6] Eluzterp: Oh, you're back! Good to see you were able to get through there. Have you got a full Slime Scooper?
[2/6] Eluzterp: Hmm, yes, everything seems to be in order. Perfect!
[3/6] Eluzterp: Thank you very much. Finally, I'll be able to get him in gear again...  Why are all Villagers so fickle like that?
[4/6] Eluzterp: Well, I suppose that's beside the point. I'll be sure to let him know you got him his most recent fix.
[5/6] Eluzterp: He hangs around in a little black stall in the bazaar, there's a basement to it. He should let you inside now.
[6/6] Eluzterp: And, for your troubles, a little something from me as well.
[1/7] Almuj Bank Guard: You look like a hardy one, Ragni army is it? Would you be willing to help Almuj a bit?
[2/7] Almuj Bank Guard: Us guards have been trying to root out desert bandits trying to rob the bank.
[3/7] Almuj Bank Guard: We're using reports from witnesses to try to gain information.
[4/7] Almuj Bank Guard: If I give you some of the witness reports, will you help get clues from them?
[5/7] Almuj Bank Guard: Great! The store from the first witness report is straight down the stairs, just past this building here, just behind me.
[6/7] Almuj Bank Guard: The store that you should read the report in is named Gibbs' Mining Supply Store, and it's the store that was robbed.
[7/7] Almuj Bank Guard: I will write the coordinates to the store so you can read the report just in case you can't find it.
Business was slow that day, until two rugged, oddly-dressed men stormed into my shop, with a lot of nerve.
[1/9] Shopkeeper Gibbs: Hello gentlemen! What can I interest you in today? Some industrial torches? Pickaxes?
Before I could close any deal with them, the man with a dagger started threatening me!
[2/9] Bandit: Shut yer' trap, old man. We came for a different kind of business.
I tried to make peace with the crooks.
[3/9] Shopkeeper Gibbs: Wha-? Look, fellows. Just step out of my store, and nobody gets hurt. I don't want any trouble.
The bandit put the knife closer to me and started demanding the code to the TNT vault downstairs!
[4/9] Bandit: Listen up old man, tell us the code to the TNT vault in the basement, or I decorate my necklace with your fingers!
[5/9] Shopkeeper Gibbs: Certainly not! That TNT is for licensed mining companies only, not your average amateur miner.
The bandits grew agitated and resorted to violence to obtain the combination.
[6/9] Bandit: Well then! I guess you'll still be able to grasp a pick with four fingers, eh?
They swiped their knife at me, leaving a sizeable wound on my arm.
[7/9] Shopkeeper Gibbs: Gaaah! Alright, alright! No more violence, please!
I had no choice but to give up the combination, which was 7812.
[8/9] Shopkeeper Gibbs: The code is 7-8-1-2... please don't hurt me!
After I gave up the combination, they knocked me out!
[9/9] Bandit: 7-8-1-2... thanks! We wont be needing you anymore... now go to sleep!
I had no idea what the criminals did after that, I never went back into my shop after the incident.
[1/6] Almuj Bank Guard: You're back, having read the report I assume. Did you find anything in particular?
[2/6] Almuj Bank Guard: Missing TNT in the shop's vault? The report was truthful and trustworthy.
[3/6] Almuj Bank Guard: We need to catch these criminals quickly if they have access to this dangerous amount of TNT, capable of putting a hole in the bank's wall.
[4/6] Almuj Bank Guard: Luckily, we recently had another witness report come in.
[5/6] Almuj Bank Guard: This report takes place on the roof of the Scroll Merchant's residence, a garden roof.
[6/6] Almuj Bank Guard: I've written the coordinates to the shop in your content book in case you don't know where the Scroll Merchant is.
I was having a fine time tending to my rooftop garden after a lengthy day of selling scrolls.
While looking down on the street, I saw two unsavory men, one with TNT in hand, marching down the path.
I was suspicious, so I tried to get their attention, but they ignored me.
[1/3] Scroll Merchant: Ey', what do you two blighters think you're doing with those dangerous explosives in the city?
I then realized that had no innocent itinerary, they were heading straight for my wealthy neighbor's house!
I tried to yell for the attention of a guard or official, but nobody could hear me.
[2/3] Scroll Merchant: Guards! Guards! Robber! Come quick! Urgently!
Before anybody could hear me, a large explosion occurred inside of the house the bandits intruded.
[3/3] Scroll Merchant: Gaaah!
The bandits came sprinting out of my wealthy neighbor's house with two of his most prized possessions: two of his weapons.
[1/8] Almuj Bank Guard: Were you able to uncover any new information regarding the status of the criminals?
[2/8] Almuj Bank Guard: Oh dear, this isn't good. The criminals plundered two very powerful weapons.
[3/8] Almuj Bank Guard: It won't be easy facing those criminals if they decide to raid the bank with those weapons.
[4/8] Almuj Bank Guard: I'm not certain how to proceed from here, we didn't receive any more witness reports, and-
[5/8] Almuj Sentry: Boss, I just received urgent reports of a robbery underway in the left residential area of Almuj!
[6/8] Almuj Bank Guard: Oh my... you! Soldier! Urgently! The robbery is taking place across the bridge, next to the first house you visited today!
[7/8] Almuj Bank Guard: There will be somebody waiting for you outside of the house once you get to the residential area!
[8/8] Almuj Bank Guard: If you still can't find it, I've written the coordinates in your content book. Now quickly, get to the house!
[1/2] Almuj Citizen: Hello? Are you with the guards? Good! Hurry! Some bandits just ransacked my house, and left with lots of emeralds!
[2/2] Almuj Citizen: Follow me to my house, hopefully you can find the bandits! They stole lots of my precious gold!
[1/4] Bandit Leader: Here-- maybe you'll help us pull the heist if I give you some of this gold we just stole.
[2/4] Bandit Leader: Ahah. I had a feeling we had a guard on our tail.
[3/4] Bandit Leader: I wouldnt want to wear out my new-stolen weapons killing you... I'll just trap you in here with all of this TNT!
[4/4] Bandit Leader: This'll blow up in a few seconds. Good luck getting out of here!
[1/1] Bandit Leader: It's too late to stop us now! Were already about to bust out of here with a grand prize sure to gain us province-wide respect!
[1/3] Bandit Leader: Look here, the soldier decided they wanted to follow us. Dumb move.
[2/3] Bandit Leader: I guess we can kill two birds with one stone: escaping the bank, and killing this pest.
[3/3] Bandit Leader: Block the entrance, bandits!
[1/1] Bandit Leader: Oh no... we've run out of TNT! We were in over our heads... We can't defeat them, just run for your life! Forget the emeralds, lets get outta here!
[1/4] Almuj Bank Guard: What happened down there underneath the bank? I heard the rumble.
[2/4] Almuj Bank Guard: You stopped the crooks? Amazing!
[3/4] Almuj Bank Guard: The Almuj bank is typically reserved for trusted members only; however, you have proven yourself today to be one of them.
[4/4] Almuj Bank Guard: Thank you for your service!
[1/4] Haily: Hello, dear. My name is Haily. Nice to meet you.
[2/4] Haily: This is the Almuj charity center. We're looking for volunteers to help the homeless this year.
[3/4] Haily: If you want to help someone else this year, our boss Nick is already out in the thick of it.
[4/4] Haily: He's a really special man. I'll write his location down for you in your book. Oh, remember this is charity work, so hopefully gratitude is a good enough reward for you.
[1/1] Haily: The world needs more people like you, so selfless.
[1/2] Haily: We're looking for volunteers for the holiday season.
[2/2] Haily: Come back when you're level 33.
[1/1] Haily: So, how is it going? Did you find Nick in the slum?
[1/7] Nick: Oh. Oh... Oh dear. There's more people here than ever.
[2/7] Nick: Hm, are you just passing through? Oh! A volunteer!
[3/7] Nick: You're the only one this year. Things have really changed. We used to have hundreds of volunteers this time of year.
[4/7] Nick: The people here are starving. There's no two ways about it.
[5/7] Nick: I don't know how we're going to feed everyone this year.
[6/7] Nick: The man who runs the budget store used to be homeless... He knows the struggles they face.
[7/7] Nick: I'll look after things here. Can you go to the budget store? It's really close. Any food is gratefully received.
[1/5] Flodur: 'ello young soldier.
[2/5] Flodur: What can I do fer ye?
[3/5] Flodur: A food donation fer the 'omless?
[4/5] Flodur: I'm sorry but everyfin is sold out, everyone is preparing for Craftmas.
[5/5] Flodur: I might have something on the attic, if you find anyfin, you can 'ave it. I know how difficult it gets.
[1/3] Flodur: Hm... This apple has seen betta days...
[2/3] Flodur: Looks like I'm fresh outta food. Barely got enough to feed meself.
[3/3] Flodur: I wish I had something to give this year. I guess people are having a feast in the city.
[1/8] Nick: Any news?
[2/8] Nick: I see. I was counting on him.
[3/8] Nick: I can't be too upset. He donates so much the rest of the year.
[4/8] Nick: We may have to ask the farmers directly...
[5/8] Nick: I know someone in Ternaves with a kind heart.
[6/8] Nick: We've fallen out before, seems he didn't understand what a donation was.
[7/8] Nick: There is a shortcut south from here, in a cave. Go through there.
[8/8] Nick: Oh, also, can you give this blanket to Margaret while you're down in the tunnel? Just follow the road behind me.
[1/3] Margaret: Oh, please don't move me along. I have no where else to go!
[2/3] Margaret: Oh, a blanket for me? How sweet... From Nick, you say? He's always so kind... Thank you, as well.
[3/3] Margaret: If you want to get to Ternaves quickly, just keep going through this tunnel. Some unfriendly homeless folks live around here too, so be careful. It's so sad, their state.
[1/4] Reshad: Welcome to my farm! Looking to buy some of my fresh crops?
[2/4] Reshad: Well, it seems you're out of luck. I've just sold the last of them from this harvest.
[3/4] Reshad: It was all for that big Craftmas feast happening in Detlas. Wish I could help you out, but I'm fresh out of food to sell you.
[4/4] Reshad: Wait, I bet Nick sent you, didn't he? Well, he's coming up on your left. Remind him that this isn't a charity.
[1/4] Nick: Hey, soldier! Any luck?
[2/4] Nick: We can't get any food? We're running out of options here...
[3/4] Nick: Well, there's only one person left that we can appeal to at this time of year.
[4/4] Nick: Follow me.
[1/9] Santa: Nick... You know the deal.
[2/9] Santa: The council all have their areas to care for. Yours is Almuj. How you care for it is your responsibility.

[1/8] Junes: A Ragni soldier! I imagine you're here to investigate the tomb up the hill?

[3/8] Junes: Instead I've been looking into a related legend - the Emperor's Sceptre.
[4/8] Junes: It was the source of his power, and potentially one of the most important artifacts in history.
[5/8] Junes: When the Emperor was slain by his son, Hashr, it is said that the sceptre was lost amongst the raging sandstorm that followed.
[6/8] Junes: ... Until now. I believe I've managed to trace its possession to a nearby group of bandits. They probably have no idea what they're sitting on.
[7/8] Junes: I'm not prepared to confront them myself, but... this artifact belongs in a museum, in the hands of careful and respectful researchers.
[8/8] Junes: I would be in your debt if you could try to retrieve it, for the sake of history.

[1/7] Caras: My tribe worries our own business, stranger.
[2/7] Caras: Oh, my apologies, I did not realize you are a warrior of the province! We would be grateful of your help.
[3/7] Caras: Our sacred owl totem that we worship was stolen by the cunning Eagle Tribe many years ago. Its magical properties used to bring prosperity to our camp.
[4/7] Caras: However, the Eagle tribe are not victorious, we possess their mystic eagle totem, but alas, I do not know who was the original thief.
[5/7] Caras: We have been at war for years now, despite being neighbors. Without our totem, our rivalry will continue for ages and peace will never again be felt in our hearts.
[6/7] Caras: Retrieve our totem, and the blessing of the Owl spirit will be with you.
[7/7] Caras: Now, enter the Eagle Camp across the river, you may have to search the camp, I'm sure they have hidden our totem!

[2/5] Favian: You seek the Owl totem? The cursed Owl tribe trying to retain their lost dignity again.
[3/5] Favian: Why should we give you their totem back? They stole our source of enlightenment all those years ago.
[4/5] Favian: Tell you what, if you can retrieve our Eagle Totem, I will allow you to go return the Owl totem.
[5/5] Favian: I'm sure they hid the totem, but if you are able to find it, I await your return!
[1/5] Favian: Wonderful! You may now enter the cave to retrieve the blasted Owl totem.
[2/5] Favian: Be careful, there are Eagle guardians in the cave, be prepared traveller.
[3/5] Favian: Once you get the totem, you may return it to its original tribe.
[4/5] Favian: Hopefully, we two camps will never set foot on another's land in an attempt to steal back the totems, and live in peace.
[5/5] Favian: Anyways, hurry up, even the thought of the two totems sharing the same space makes me sick.
