[6/8] Excavator Placardus: So we instructed all of our employees in all of our sites to thwart you at any cost. Historical loss is a very important issue, especially with something so powerful.
[7/8] Excavator Placardus: But after hearing the stories of your travels in the province, we realised what had happened, and you mistook us for the enemy. This is obviously not the case.

[1/1] Traitor Thomas: I'm sorry, I can't let you in there until you prove yourself!
[1/1] Traitor Thomas: I can't let you in, we're busy looking for an important document, I'm sure these eyes have something to do with it...
[1/4] Traitor Thomas: Is that...  The map fragments? You found them!
[2/4] Traitor Thomas: Oh my, you better come in.
[3/4] Traitor Thomas: There's not enough time! We need to combine those fragments with ours!
[4/4] Traitor Thomas: Hurry, get in the hideout!
[1/1] Traitor Thomas: Thanks for helping with that long task...
[1/8] Traitor Amadel: Welcome, friend. I knew you would figure it all out.
[2/8] Traitor Amadel: You must be surprised to see me. The excavation crew at site C tried very hard to kill me.
[3/8] Traitor Amadel: They didn't succeed though. I got away, and I swiped a fragment of a map, and I found out what it's for.
[4/8] Traitor Amadel: If you made it this far, you know Wynn Excavation are not what they seem. They want to harness Wynn's ancient power.
[5/8] Traitor Amadel: They control our governments, authorities and seem to be 3 steps ahead of any of us that oppose them.
[6/8] Traitor Amadel: That is, unless we're able to beat the excavationists to the last crystal.
[7/8] Traitor Amadel: They cannot use a single shard of power without combining them all.
[8/8] Traitor Amadel: Here, I've combined the map fragments behind me. It looks like it's deep in the jungle, I wonder where...
[1/1] Traitor Buice: WynnExcavation have done really horrible things, and I used to help...
[1/1] Traitor Jaynar: WynnExcavation will be destroyed, no matter what!
[1/8] Excavator Admin Uci: Oh my. It's you. I can't say I'm surprised to see you, we thought you might be stupid enough to come here.
[2/8] Excavator Admin Uci: Stupid enough to come here, yet, smart enough to make it.
[3/8] Excavator Admin Uci: You were at every site, taking shards and attempting to thwart us.
[4/8] Excavator Admin Uci: This time we won, and you lost.
[5/8] Excavator Admin Uci: What do your shards mean to us when we have all four crystals?
[6/8] Excavator Admin Uci: Nothing, that's what.
[7/8] Excavator Admin Uci: The boss wants to speak to you, I don't recommend keeping him waiting, he's not a patient man.
[8/8] Excavator Admin Uci: He'll be waiting for you, head through that door.
[1/1] Excavator Sean: My boss Uci is a bit of a mean guy, but hey the perks of minionship aren't bad!
[1/1] WynnExcavation Scientist Azure: This leads deeper into this dungeon, but it seems like it has to be activated from the other side.
[1/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: Well, well. Looks like you've finally made it.
[2/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: You might be a little shocked to see me here...
[3/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: Everything was planned you see...
[4/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: You finding that old fool in the desert, you surviving that fall.
[5/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: You finding that notebook, and eventually meeting me.
[6/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: Everything that you have done has been planned by the mastermind behind this organisation, me.
[7/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: You don't get it, do you? We needed you from the start. These otherworldly crystals are a powerful magic, but a dangerous one at that.

[8/8] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: We needed you, an unaware human with some form of pure intent to bring empowered shards here. Anyone else would have ran off with the shards, and turned against us. It's just how it all works. I don't expect you to understand.. Now. Enough talking.
[1/1] WynnExcavation Leader Amadel: Step into this hole, and accept your fate. It's over, you've lost!
[1/2] Amadel's Assistant: I see you have finally shown up.
[2/2] Amadel's Assistant: There is no chance someone as weak as you can beat Amadel!
[1/1] Corrupted Amadel: The crystals combine the power of the stars themselves.. an ultimate power... the power to reign over the entire WORLD!
[1/2] Amadel's Assistant: That was a mere fluke..
[2/2] Amadel's Assistant: Amadel is unbeatable!
[1/1] Shadow Amadel: I- I- I feel... unstopable.. this power... will not allow me to lose..!!!
[1/2] Amadel's Assistant: He's simply warming up..
[2/2] Amadel's Assistant: THIS ISN'T EVEN HIS FINAL FORM!
[1/1] Amadel: DID YOU REALLY THINK YOU COULD WIN?!?! YOU ARE NOTHING COMPARED TO ME! NOTHING!! I WILL EXTERMINATE ALL LIFE, STARTING WITH YOU!! NOW, PERISH!!!
[1/2] Amadel's Assistant: I, I can't believe you beat him...
[2/2] Amadel's Assistant: Amadel was a god...He was going to save the province...
[1/18] Ragni's King: You... hmm... Ahh yes! I remember you. You're one of the recruits I accepted long ago..
[2/18] Ragni's King: I'm no mage, but what you have there may just be one of the most destructive forces in the entire world.
[3/18] Ragni's King: I remember being told something by my adoptive father, and he was a king of Ragni himself!
[4/18] Ragni's King: He told me that the Wynn province will never find solace. I never truly understood why, until now.
[5/18] Ragni's King: You see, many  forces are at work on our lands that we cannot physically see, but the outcome of the influences cannot be ignored.

[6/18] Ragni's King: Creatures that you can find in Wynn may not exist in Gavel. In Gavel, there are many magical beings. Creatures influenced by forces other than the Corruption. Not all of them are friendly, mind.
[7/18] Ragni's King: But rarely do you see the undead in such numbers. You know, there is a fundamental law of our land, when two forces collide, there is war.
[8/18] Ragni's King: This could be people, species, or anything, really. And I think the same thing can be said for the energy that resonate in those crystals you have there.

[9/18] Ragni's King: I think those crystals represent a force far beyond what we can grasp, and if that power can turn one man into what you fought back there,  I shudder to think what else it could do.
[10/18] Ragni's King: The Olm in the jungle clearly knew of this, too, as they met their eventual demise. Their desperation most likely led to them attempting to harness that power, as well.
[11/18] Ragni's King: These are things that the mages of the ocean have studied in secret for centuries. We may never know, and rather, I think we never should know.

[12/18] Ragni's King: If Amadel taught us anything, it's that we can never be trusted with power. Here, put that crystal into the lava. Let it burn and never be used. The king places the crystals in the lava, and watches them sink.
[13/18] Ragni's King: Though it contains some of the most concentrated magical power ever, it is still limited to its container. Let it burn.
[14/18] Ragni's King: I do not know the severity of the Excavation's integration into the powers of Gavel, but I bet we haven't seen the last of them.
[15/18] Ragni's King: You have done this province an unspeakable service. I believe that even Bob is smiling down on you, today. I'm sure that if he were here with us, he would crown you worthy.
[16/18] Ragni's King: As a token of our city's eternal gratitude, I wish for you to take this. It has no value to anyone except you.
[17/18] Ragni's King: You might want to hold onto it, a merchant in Cinfras has arrived and you will be able to trade it for the item that I wish I could bestow upon you now.

[18/18] Ragni's King: You truly are one of the greatest warriors to ever step foot in these lands. I hereby knight you as Wynn's true protector for your deeds today. I hope we meet again, young master.
[1/6] Ormrod: Uh, you shouldn't have come here!
[2/6] Ormrod: I am cursed. Everywhere I go, trouble starts. I decided to stay away from civilization, where I can't cause any more trouble.
[3/6] Ormrod: It all started when I discovered an old tomb... upon entering it, the ground started shaking and I heard some inhuman screams coming from the tomb.
[4/6] Ormrod: I ran as far as I could. I learnt after that this was the tomb of a mummy... that I accidentally have awoken.
[5/6] Ormrod: If you could get rid of this mummy, maybe the curse would go away.
[6/6] Ormrod: Achper knows a lot about mummies, you should go talk to him. He lives somewhere in Almuj.
[1/6] Achper: If I know about mummies? Of course! I've spent my entire life studying them!
[2/6] Achper: They usually are very hard to reach, hidden in their tomb.
[3/6] Achper: I know what happened to Ormrod, and the only way to remove the powerful curse would be to kill the mummy.
[4/6] Achper: The tomb is north from here, but be very careful!
[5/6] Achper: Mummies aren't known to be weak... especially that one. It's demonic...pure evil, I have never seen such strength in a being.
[6/6] Achper: On top of that, the Creden Tibus bandit clan have been ransacking the tomb. They might not let you inside without some negotiating.
[1/1] Achper: Glad to hear you came back alive! Those mummies aren't always easy, eh?
[1/1] Achper: Hi! If you are looking for some information about mummies, I can help you!
[1/3] Bandit: Hey, what are you doing? If you're trying to loot the tomb, me and the other Creden Tibus already beat you to it.
[2/3] Bandit: But if you can bring me [1 Block of Pink Wool], I'll look the other way and let you into the tomb. I know it sounds ridiculous, but it's valuable.
[3/3] Bandit: You can get it from Rymek in the southern canyon. Only other way if from a rare sheep or something, so Rymek's the better option.
[1/4] Bandit: Well, whaddya know?  You got some Pink Wool! Okay, hand it here and I'll look the other way and let you into the tomb.
[2/4] Bandit: But I feel like it's only fair that I warn you that it's dangerous in there.
[3/4] Bandit: It took our entire clan just to make it out alive.
[4/4] Bandit: I'll still let you inside if you want. Just remember, if anyone asks, this conversation never happened.
[1/4] Ormrod: Uh, hello again... What are those bandages?
[2/4] Ormrod: Those are the mummy's bandages?! You did it! My curse is finally lifted!
[3/4] Ormrod: I can't thank you enough! As a reward, take this rag I got from the mummy when I entered the tomb.
[4/4] Ormrod: I am not strong enough to wear it, but I'm sure you are! Take these emeralds too, that's the least I can do!
[1/1] Ormrod: Thank you so much for removing the curse!
[1/1] Ormrod: Don't stand close to me, I am cursed! Come back when you're level 36, you might be able to help me.
[1/9] Svin: I am one of the Keepers in the great Temple of Legends. There we hoard secrets about the world.
[2/9] Svin: I am here to investigate an old tale of the canyon. Does that interest you? I'm sure it does!
[3/9] Svin: Legend has it that a ferocious beast lives among these cliffs. A dangerous bird that has survived for many years.
[4/9] Svin: I would love to seek the beast out, but it seems the natives here are too busy thieving each other to inform me of it.
[5/9] Svin: I have heard of an old prospector nearby who has ventured throughout this mesa. He may have some information.
[6/9] Svin: His name is Jankan and he lives east from Rymek. Could you perhaps seek him out and ask him about this foul beast?
[7/9] Svin: If you help me, I'll let you use the elevators spread in the canyon. Well...
[8/9] Svin: A strange hermit decided to take control of them, but I'm sure we can reason with him.
[9/9] Svin: I hope you are able to find the beast, and if you do, could you bring me back [1 Beast Egg] as evidence?
[1/6] Jankan: Hello there, youngster! Ye must be the stranger folks 'been talkin' 'bout.
[2/6] Jankan: If yer lookin fer gold, I can promise ye that there ain' any for you in this here mineshaft!
[3/6] Jankan: Oh.. Yer lookin fer a winged wilder beast? Are ye out of yer mind?
[4/6] Jankan: The devil of a bird is complete chaos! It can move mountains with a single screech! Men twice yer size 'ave weeped from the sight of it!
[5/6] Jankan: As it turns out, I did me back in trying to transport me earnin's from that there cave, left them right at the back did' I.
[6/6] Jankan: Go fetch me my [5 Gold Chunks] from the end of the shaft and I'll tell ye where ye need to go next.
[1/4] Jankan: Finally! It took ye long enough, hand it over! Oh right.. yer want'n somethin'.
[2/4] Jankan: I ain' got any intention of help'n ye with yer demise, but I can send ye along to a young fellow who might help.
[3/4] Jankan: There's this Hermit feller ye wanna talk to, he is a right nutter, that one. Feeds the bird'n all.
[4/4] Jankan: I think ye can find him up the mountain and across the canyon abyss, he ain' a friendly fella, I can tell yer that much.
[1/7] Hermit: What do you think you're doing here, kid? Think you can waltz in my humble abode and get across my bridge?
[2/7] Hermit: Oh, you want to know about the bird of the mountain? Hah, a little weed like you wouldn't stand a chance against it.
[3/7] Hermit: It doesn't take kindly to strangers you know. I once saw it turn a group of poachers to ash!
[4/7] Hermit: If you want to go through here, you'll need to pay. Oh, I don't want your money, why would I need money, I have everything!
[5/7] Hermit: If you want access to these plateaus then you will have to find me a rare flower for my little cave here.
[6/7] Hermit: It is found on top of one of the stacks in the mesa, it shouldn't be too hard to find.
[7/7] Hermit: Bring me [1 Rare Rose] and I shall let you pass on to the creature of the mesa.
[1/5] Hermit: A ha! This will do perfectly. My chickling will love it! I suppose you can cross the bridge now.
[2/5] Hermit: The beast dwells on top of one of these plateaus. With a little searching, you should be able to find it.
[3/5] Hermit: I'll let you use my elevators too. After all, it's not like you will last long...
[4/5] Hermit: Only one traveler I have heard of could stand against the beast. I believe he took an egg from it for a pet, hah!
[5/5] Hermit: He is long gone now, just like you will be in a few moments. It was nice not knowing you, kid.
[1/1] Hermit: What's taken you so long, kid? I just want [1 Rare Rose]!
[1/1] Hermit: What are you here for, eh kid? Get out. Get!
[1/1] Hermit: Think you can waltz in my humble abode and get across my bridge? Get out!
[1/5] Svin: Traveler! You have returned! Tell me, what have you learned?
[2/5] Svin: You found it?! This is wonderful news! You collected an egg from it's nest as well? You are very brave indeed!
[3/5] Svin: So the legend of the Cockatrice is true! You've seen it and battled it with your own courage!
[4/5] Svin: If only you could enter the Temple of Legends, brave soul! But it would seem our paths are to part now.
[5/5] Svin: Do not worry, I shall keep the egg safe. One day your legend shall be as greatly told!
[1/8] Damiral: Lo, adventurer! Welcome to the great province of Gavel, home of the villager race, and yours truly. You'll be headed into the grand citadel of Llevigar soon!
[2/8] Damiral: But enough with the pleasantries. Tell me... Ever heard the tale of the great pirate, Captain Hastor? Sailed the seas a long time ago.
[3/8] Damiral: Legend says that when Llevigar was rebuilt all those years ago, he hid his fortune within the walls someplace!
[4/8] Damiral: I'm a retired sailor now, but I could still do with a few extra emeralds from that treasure. Perhaps, if you're up to it... we could come to an agreement?
[5/8] Damiral: I have a riddle, the first of a number of clues that are supposed to lead to where Hastor hid his fortune, but I can't for the life of me figure it out.
[6/8] Damiral: Maybe you'll be able to solve it. If you can, I'll make sure to split the treasure with you!
[7/8] Damiral: This first riddle goes like so: Toward the sunset, among northern flowers shaded by quartz.
[8/8] Damiral: I do wish you good luck, adventurer! Remember, everything you need to solve the clues should be found somewhere inside Llevigar.
[1/3] Damiral: Aha! I'd come to ask how it was coming when I saw you jump over here!
[2/3] Damiral: Phenomenal work, my compatriot. Though, do remember our deal?
[3/3] Damiral: You find the treasure, I give you a cut. I'll just take my part and be on my way!
[1/6] Adigard: Welcome traveler, to our humble island...
[2/6] Adigard: My people and I landed here many years ago. Unfortunately, our ship didn't make it...
[3/6] Adigard: We tried to build a nation on these islands but became divided through the years.
[4/6] Adigard: Because of this, we are fighting a useless war with our neighbours.
[5/6] Adigard: I believe we should try to pass a peace treaty, but I am afraid of getting killed if I leave the island...
[6/6] Adigard: Would you mind helping us? Talk to Hallfred about this treaty. He lives on another ice island nearby.
[1/1] Adigard: Have you made any progress?
[1/5] Hallfred: Welcome traveler! What brings you to our island?
[2/5] Hallfred: Oh, I see that Adigard now sends strangers through his cowardice! Worried he'll get killed?
[3/5] Hallfred: This is the last time I'll repeat it: We will sign the peace treaty the day Adigard and his nation will return to us... the treasure.
[4/5] Hallfred: The one that they kept and hid from us after the shipwreck.
[5/5] Hallfred: Pure gold, very valuable and rare! Tell him I'll be waiting for it. And none of that silly story again.
[1/7] Adigard: I should have expected that. Hallfred was always very greedy...
[2/7] Adigard: We tried to make him understand that we do not have the treasure, without much success.
[3/7] Adigard: ...You see, the reason why we became shipwrecked wasn't natural cause. We were attacked...
[4/7] Adigard: By whom? The undead. Ghosts and demons navigating a monstrous ship. They got us by surprise.
[5/7] Adigard: I believe they also stole our treasure during the attack.
[6/7] Adigard: Would you help our nation come back together? Find this ship, and bring the treasure back to Hallfred so we can finally live in peace.
[7/7] Adigard: Sail north. That is where they attacked us many years ago. It should be easy to find, I'm sure they are anchored there in glory... Thank you.
[1/4] Hallfred: Incredible! He actually delivered the treasure!
[2/4] Hallfred: I suppose that means the end of the war between our nations!
[3/4] Hallfred: This is a great day! Here, take this as a reward for helping our nation.
[4/4] Hallfred: I'm sure you'll find a use for this helmet one day!
[1/1] Hallfred: Hey, we don't just let strangers use our people like that!
[1/1] Hallfred: I am glad everything is back to normal.
[1/1] Hallfred: It's useless to come back to me if you do not have the treasure.
[1/1] Adigard: Thank you so much for bringing peace between our nations!
[1/1] Adigard: Our nation greatly needs help, but I'm afraid you aren't strong enough. Come back to me when you are level 40.
[1/11] Ankou: Hehehe... Hello there.
[2/11] Ankou: Welcome to the Tower of Ascension!
[3/11] Ankou: I challenge you to reach the final floor!
[4/11] Ankou: Have you got what it takes to conquer it?
[5/11] Ankou: Perhaps you would like to know the layout of the tower first? Hehehehe...
[6/11] Ankou: There are 7 floors in this tower, each with ten levels.
[7/11] Ankou: Each floor has nine regular levels and one boss level.
[8/11] Ankou: To pass a regular level, you must collect five tokens from the challenge on that level, and one token from boss levels.
[9/11] Ankou: After you beat a whole floor, you will return here and you can begin the next one...
[10/11] Ankou: So, what do you say? Hehehe...
[11/11] Ankou: Turn left and head to the first floor...if you dare...
[1/6] Ankou: You have completed my tower, I see...
[2/6] Ankou: Did you enjoy Death? Many challengers certainly did. Her power is... unmatched, hehehe...
[3/6] Ankou: And you... You are unlike them all, yes? Few have managed to ascend these floors.
[4/6] Ankou: A tower of madness, fueled by Death herself... Quite a challenge, yes?
[5/6] Ankou: You have joined us now, champion... Few can claim this victory as their own. Fewer still have held their mind.
[6/6] Ankou: For this honor... A reward, for you. You have truly earned it... Hehehehe...
[1/6] Zenam: Aaah, no no no! This doesn't make any sense, what in the world is going on?! Nothing's working!
[2/6] Zenam: Gweh, a visitor? Get out of here! The plant is shut down for maintenance- wait, are you the electromagic expert we're paying for?
[3/6] Zenam: You are, right? Right?! Cause we can't wait any longer! This system was supposed to be unbreakable, a flawless design!
[4/6] Zenam: We didn't even need to get Corkian consultation on this, we had this system all figured out ourselves, but now nothing's working right!
[5/6] Zenam: You're seeing all these sparks and hearing all this crackling? We have no idea what could possibly be going wrong with this! That's why you're needed here!
[6/6] Zenam: We don't have much time until full meltdown! There is an entrance to the power plant opposite the bank, go there and meet with the Head Engineer!
[1/5] Head Engineer: Whew, finally Zeman found a guy for the job. I told him weeks ago this was a two-person task...
[2/5] Head Engineer: Wait, it's Zenam? Eh, what does it matter? You knew who I was talkin' about. Lemme give you the lowdown real fast.
[3/5] Head Engineer: About a month ago, there was a big blackout, and the generator here started acting up. Power surges, appliances overloading...heck, some of our lights turned purple!
[4/5] Head Engineer: My grandfather and his engineers jury-rigged this whole system. A reset should fix all this, but as a security measure, I need to be here to oversee the reset.
[5/5] Head Engineer: So that's your job- get through the system and find the reset button. These holes'll lead you around the generator rooms. Better get going!
[1/5] Head Engineer: Alright, that should do it- Ah, you're back. The system reset just fine, like I said. Everything should be winding down now.
[2/5] Head Engineer: It's purging the excess energy now- might have a few more power surges and crackles for a while, but it'll go back to normal soon enough.
[3/5] Head Engineer: Hm? What, there was a bug in the system? ...what, are you asleep or something? Of course there was a bug, we just fixed it!
[4/5] Head Engineer: Well, anyways, Zebra should have our payment all settled. You go on ahead- I still need to stay down here to make sure everything stays smooth.
[5/5] Head Engineer: ...oh, it's Zenam? D'you really care about getting his name right, or what? Anyways, the exit's through the water cooling system, it hooks up to the sewer exit.
[1/1] Head Engineer: I have to stay put, so get through the system and find the reset button for me. These holes are teleporters that'll lead you around the generator rooms.
[1/1] Head Engineer: Were you bein' literal when you said there was a bug in the system? I swear I hear something crawling around down here all of the sudden.
[1/4] Zenam: Whew...welcome back. The power is back online- Everything is running at full capacity again. I think the system is just running excess through right now.
[2/4] Zenam: Glad you got here when you did though- some phony came through saying he was the expert. Clearly he was just here to take your contract money...
[3/4] Zenam: Though, I was panicking so much I probably would've believed him... Speaking of which, here's your cut of the pay, and something extra for the trouble.
[4/4] Zenam: Here's to hoping that the system won't run into any more trouble in the future. I don't want to be faced with an impending cataclysm like that again...
[1/6] Captain Kymer: Aha, another Ragni soldier, eh? Well, a warm welcome to you.
[2/6] Captain Kymer: Did you hear about the requests from the Villagers we've gotten? They say these Orcs and "Goblins" are threatening their towns and cities.
[3/6] Captain Kymer: Primitive, brutal things, apparently little better than the zombies we're used to, at least according to the Llevigar military.
[4/6] Captain Kymer: So, we figure if might makes right with them, then defeating their leaders should scare them into submission.
[5/6] Captain Kymer: Our scouts have identified three chief orcs in the area- Elisu, Ceifko, and Veltu. Though, strangely Veltu is always surrounded by goblins...

[6/6] Captain Kymer: Well whatever the case, we're needed to defend Llevigar here. Can you handle the chiefs? They seem to hide in the camps with green flags- search the plains, return once they're dealt with!
[1/5] Captain Kymer: Ah, the soldier from earlier! You're back, I see. Any luck defeating those- ...yeesh. Are those their heads?
[2/5] Captain Kymer: That's...harsher than I intended, but it works... Not like the Villagers care if they're dead or alive, as long as they're dealt with. I have your share of the reward here.
[3/5] Captain Kymer: This kind of surgical strike should help prevent an all-out war with the Orcs. Not sure we'd want a full-scale war to deal with in each province, hah!
[4/5] Captain Kymer: You saw that the creatures in Gavel aren't akin to Wynnic fare while you were out, yes? They're a bit, ah...livelier than usual. Better get used to it.
[5/5] Captain Kymer: The next major settlement is Olux, in the swamp up north, but I hear the swamp ogres are a lot tougher than the plains' fare. I'd stick around here and train up, first.
[1/5] Agent: Hey you! Human. What are you doing here?
[2/5] Agent: Under Villager law any extra terrestrial or extra voidal entities are prohibited and owned by the state.
[3/5] Agent: Seeing as you are new to the land, I can't see you being prosecuted, especially a Ragni Guard.
[4/5] Agent: This meteor is different to what we've seen before. We suspect that direct contact with the meteor is dangerous.
[5/5] Agent: The magical radiation doesn't seem to be affecting you at all though. Do you not feel anything? Perhaps you could help me locate it.
[1/1] Thief: .... I can't control myself...fjfjfj This rock...
[1/2] Thief: What is... this feeling... No I won't listen..
[2/2] Thief: I can't... control... my mind... end me.
[1/4] Agent: Hello again. Did you find the meteor down there? Why on earth are you holding some?!
[2/4] Agent: I see. This material is incredibly rare and magically powerful. Meteors fall all over Gavel and come in a variety of colours and potency.
[3/4] Agent: We don't fully understand them, but we know they are dangerous. Every scientist who has studied them has lost their minds.
[4/4] Agent: The meteors hold many secrets and powers, maybe the ones we need to end your war. Thank you, here's a small reward for helping us.
[1/9] Telvu: Ah, a member of the Ragni army. We're trying to gain entry to this frozen barrow. We could use your aid.
[2/9] Telvu: Are you familiar with the story of Theorick and Nesaak?
[3/9] Telvu: Probably not. Well, you see, Nesaak was not always frozen.
[4/9] Telvu: During Theorick's time, this place was like the Wynn plains, warm and arable.
[5/9] Telvu: For some reason, Theorick Twain used his immense power to freeze the land before exiling himself here.
[6/9] Telvu: We need to find out why so we can reverse this spell. Presumably, the source of that spell's magic would be within here.
[7/9] Telvu: As such...have you heard of a place called Time Valley? We could use it to go back in time, to try to learn more about this barrier.
[8/9] Telvu: Well...in a way, at least. There are laws to this sort of magic. For one, you need an item from the specific time we want to see. Second, you can witness the past, not change it.
[9/9] Telvu: One of Theorick's staves is on display in the Nesaak bank. Presumably, it should work for what we need. Could you retrieve it somehow?
[1/5] Telvu: Aha, quick job. I see you've got the wand. Must've needed a sharp tongue to get the bankers to give it up.
[2/5] Telvu: Now, it is a long walk to Time Valley. Needn't take that walk, though, as I can teleport you there. Hopefully.
[3/5] Telvu: Once you're there, enter the Temple of Time. You should know what to do once you are there. Careful dealing with time travel, friend... No idea what you might find.
[5/5] Telvu: Should anything go wrong, I'll stay here to teleport you back to the temple.

[3/5] Calamaro: We didn't have enough to eat, we were forced to steal their fish, we would have starved otherwise. And now they want their fish, our fish back? We can't do that, I hope you understand.
[4/5] Calamaro: However we don't have to fight over the fish in the lake, we just need a [Mythic Everlasting Pufferfish], that would be enough, nothing else. We never wanted to steal the fish.

[5/5] Calamaro: If you want to help us and the villagers, just follow the stream that flows into this lake to the south, you will find the best fishing ground there. The pufferfish should be around there too.

[5/5] Gernald: Can I ask you something? As you might see I'm not the richest guy, or the youngest. If you manage to catch that fish, could you hand it over? I know we just met but you seem like somebody who would help an old man.

[2/2] Gernald: There it comes, the [Mythic Everlasting Pufferfish], I can't believe it!

[1/9] Tarod: You're one of those soldier types, right?  My name is Tarod, and I could really use your assistance here.
[2/9] Tarod: Years ago, I met a very powerful and legendary warrior by the name of Bob. Yes, that Bob.
[3/9] Tarod: It's safe to say he was a very, well, admirable man. Him and I slowly became close friends over the years.
[4/9] Tarod: That is, until one night, he vanished without a trace. The accepted story is that he was murdered by a pack of ravenous wolves...

[5/9] Tarod: Now, I don't buy that story, but... look, the point here is that he's gone now, and I want to find out where the hell he ended up. That depressing zombie lumbering around Ragni clearly isn't him.
[6/9] Tarod: I believe he died in this area, and I have been looking for his body for quite a while now, with... less than success.
[7/9] Tarod: Rumors have spread that a tomb lies somewhere east of Nesaak, but I've never been able to find it. This is where I need you to help me out, yeah?
[8/9] Tarod: Do you think you could help me out here? Search around that area, and report back to me if you see anything noteworthy.
[9/9] Tarod: I'd be eternally grateful if you could help me uncover my old friend's true story.
[1/6] Tarod: Welcome back. Did you find anything worthwhile?
[2/6] Tarod: Oh? Yeah, that definitely sounds like the tomb! Were you able to see what's inside?
[3/6] Tarod: No? There's... a magical barrier? Great... just GREAT...

[4/6] Tarod: I have a feeling whoever made that tomb didn't want anyone attempting to get to him, but... Forget it, we have no other options. This is the only way we can place Bob's soul to rest for good.
[5/6] Tarod: Listen, I have a guy who can help us out. His name is Wedyf, a sorcerer type. If anyone could get rid of that barrier, it would be him.
[6/6] Tarod: He lives in Bremminglar, a small town close to Almuj. Go meet him, I'll wait for your return.
[1/10] Wedyf: Welcome traveler. Are you looking for something?
[2/10] Wedyf: Ooh, it has been a long time since I've released an undead...
[3/10] Wedyf: The spirit of your dead friend must still be somewhere in this world. This is why we are unable to get close to his body. Soul magic works in mysterious ways.
[4/10] Wedyf: Don't worry, I can do it. I've heard a little bit of Bob's story before. What a tragedy. His own infallible protection used against him...
[6/10] Wedyf: ...Anyways, there's no need to lament on the past. Now, we need two items. The first is something from Bob himself. The other is the last thing that made his blood drop.
[7/10] Wedyf: Out past the other side of Detlas, near Nesaak, there are some arches in the mountains. An old florist lives in a house close by. She has a rose that Bob had once cut himself on.
[8/10] Wedyf: I will warn you, though; she was corrupted some time ago. It may not be that easy to take the rose, so do be prepared.

[9/10] Wedyf: Secondly... something of Bob's. I've heard rumors of a visage of him wandering around Ragni, perhaps you can find something of use from it? Killing enemies in the Nesaak region may be worth your time, as well.
[10/10] Wedyf: Bring me [1 Rose] and [1 Bob's Tear].
[1/6] Wedyf: Great, you got everything.
[2/6] Wedyf: Although... I might have forgot to tell you about something else too...
[3/6] Wedyf: We also need a part of the soul of your dead friend.
[4/6] Wedyf: This is something I unfortunately cannot do myself. There is a blacksmith close to Ternaves who does this kind of stuff.
[5/6] Wedyf: He can extract the soul from someone's weapon. Very useful in those situations. Go talk to him.
[6/6] Wedyf: Bring me the soul, and I'll be able to remove the spell preventing you from entering the tomb.

[1/1] Doubiss: Ah, good day to ya! What is it ye be needin' from ol' Doubiss' stock?
[1/10] Doubiss: Good day to ya! What is it ye be needin' from ol' Doubiss' stock?

[1/7] Voer: Hello! Hmm, armour, weapon, look of grim despair... You must be from the Wynn province!

[3/7] Voer: Lately, this Decay has been making business rather tough. The magical plants that used to grow here are dying.
[4/7] Voer: The need for magic has never been as big as it is now, and without supplies, the magicians of the swamp simply cannot operate!
[5/7] Voer: I need Death Whistle in particular. It's not as deadly as it sounds, I promise- the name's just archaic, if I recall right from that- er, my book.
[6/7] Voer: It is a rather rare plant with all sorts of mystical properties, so much so that it can animate objects around it!
[7/7] Voer: Look for the highest mountain in the swamp south-east from here. The decay hasn't reached the peaks yet, you see!

[1/2] Witch: Ah, um, come back later please! Something strange is happening!

[1/8] Voer: You're back, I see...and you're shedding petals! You got the Pink Pelulite back?

[5/8] Voer: I need an income, and the swamp isn't exactly the most resource rich region here! Especially not any more.

[1/9] Caissop: ...hm...mh!

[1/7] Caissop: Quick! Describe it to me! Go on!

[7/8] Caissop: It is down a road, with short, round-cupped flowers. Those ones smell orange to me!
[8/8] Caissop: Hurry! I'll finish this animal while you are gone. OH, YES. MUY MACHO.

[2/7] Caissop: ...Oh, yes... YES. I LOVE IT.

[1/8] Lari: ...Havent we met? I have witnessed your presence in Gavel more than once.
[2/8] Lari: I am Lari. I might have greeted you properly before if I were not so busy, which reminds me. You have a reason to be here, yes?
[3/8] Lari: Hm...I believe I know what you have found, by your description. That dead skin too, is proof enough, I would say.
[4/8] Lari: The creature which shed that skin is known as a Grootslang. Though large, they are rather peaceful. Gentle giants, I believe the saying is?
[5/8] Lari: This horrid Decay...it affects their habitats underground. They are seeking shelter closer to the surface. I have been trying to scrub the Decay without success...
[6/8] Lari: Wait... More holes appeared just today? There...there were deaths?! W-where, when?!
[7/8] Lari: No, no...! I refuse to be responsible for any more deaths... Human, tell me your name, please.
[8/8] Lari: soldier, then... Let us head to the site. I need to fix this... Please, help me get to the root of this problem so I may soothe the land's pain.
[1/3] Lari: So this is the site...   '  ...
[2/3] Lari: Here. Allow me to provide at least one person safe passage into the pit.
[3/3] Lari: Have faith- Jump in. I will carry you down slowly.
[1/1] Lari: Take the lead. If we can find any further evidence of the Grootslangs around here, it will aid in my understanding.
[1/3] Lari: Hm? This wall looks like it's been disturbed recently...
[2/3] Lari: I can hear it...but where is it crawling...?
[3/3] Lari: That's the mother Wyrm! She must be what is making the holes. We need to follow her!
[1/1] Lari: Take the lead.
[1/7] Lari: Ah...ehm, soldier? I've... Um, this is...a bit difficult to say, but...
[2/7] Lari: I...do not believe we need to fight, or to kill, here? The creatures are native to here, we are invading their space.
[3/7] Lari: Why should they be attacked for merely existing in their territory? Even if they are animals, I believe that you can solve these problems without killing.
[4/7] Lari: I...understand you may not have the same powers as myself... And I, ah...am not free of guilt, either. But I think you could stand to take a peaceful stance.
[5/7] Lari: Even if I am alone on that front...though I understand you are taught differently where you come from. I do not envy you, though I still thank you for your aid thusfar.
[6/7] Lari: Your methods are...disagreeable, but you still have a sense of right to you, I feel... Well, the tunnel diverges here. We'll need to split apart.
[7/7] Lari: I'll go to the right, so you ought to continue to the left here. I will meet up with you again soon, hopefully.
[1/12] Lari: Aah! soldier! Don't...don't make any sudden movements.
[2/12] Lari: This Grootslang is uncharacteristically aggressive... She's scared, being so close to the surface. Stay behind me, please.
[3/12] Lari: AH! !
[4/12] Lari: Do not approach it! The power of the Wyrm is far too much for you!
[5/12] Lari: W-wait, again? -- Aah, MOVE!
[6/12] Lari: soldier!! You're unharmed, yes? She's scared and in pain!
[7/12] Lari: I have to get it right this time... I'm going to talk her down, stay there!
[8/12] Lari: You must be calm, I beg you. Retreat to the earth- You harm those above!
[9/12] Lari: The earth rotting... I take full responsibility, but does the grass above not rot also?
[10/12] Lari: I wish to soothe your pain, but you must allow me to aid you- You must listen!
[11/12] Lari: What does this violence solve? Be calm, please!
[12/12] Lari: soldier, it won't budge... There's something in its mind rejecting me. Distract it- but don't approach! It will kill you if you get close. Just...be loud!
[1/16] Lari: AIYEE! soldier! Hold on in there!
[2/16] Lari: Can you hear me?! I'll get her to...to...s-something! Spit you up, I don't know! Just...please, d-don't die!
[3/16] Lari: W-We have... We have not laid a blow against you! It is not right for you to do the same!
[4/16] Lari: You would wound and consume everything in your rage? Even knowing the consequences?
[5/16] Lari: Your hunger cannot be sated with this fruitless destruction! I beg of you, let them out!
[6/16] Lari: You know th- W-wait...where did you... AAAH!
[7/16] Lari: ...y-you... soldier... I...y-you're still alright? I...*hic* I...
[8/16] Lari: I tried...w-why does no one listen to me? Why won't a-anything change for me?
[9/16] Lari: She...she's been eating dark parasites. They're wracking her insides and h-hurting her head...
[10/16] Lari: I...i-it's so d-dark... I c-can't breathe... This...th-this can't be the end...
[11/16] Lari: I...n-no, I can't die in here... I-I'm needed still... You're n-needed still! I... I...
[12/16] Lari: I n-need... Or... O-Or... C-Concentrate, Lari... You can do this...
[14/16] Lari: LET US OUT! LET US OUT OF HERE! DON'T LET US DIE LIKE THIS! I'M BEGGING YOU, PLEASE!!
[15/16] Lari: ...I...oh no... It's...d-d... I... I j-just... I just w-wanted out... Ohhh...n-no...
[16/16] Lari: ...w-we're...leaving. I...I c-can't look at this any more...
[1/5] Lari: ...I... That's...m-my fault...
[2/5] Lari: I'm...I'm so sorry, soldier. If I'd...I don't... I don't even know what else I could have d-done...
[3/5] Lari: There...it didnt feel like there was...anything left to it... But, if Id just been quicker, then... Would it...would it even have made a difference?
[4/5] Lari: ...some savior I am... I need to be better, but what else even is there that...ugh, I'm going in circles...
[5/5] Lari: Let's... Let's just leave...
[1/6] Lari: ...I...I can't believe this. This is...does destiny just hate me? What have I done to deserve this?!

[11/15] Lari: This...this isn't like you... You would never have done this before! You dedicated your life to trying to help...so w-why are you...m...m-m... I-I'm leaving!!
[12/15] Lari: What have I done...? This...he's... He's not th-the same anymore... What changed? Is this my fault...? I c-can't understand it...
[13/15] Lari: ...but...I'll... I'll protect them. I'll protect him... I...there has to be a way. But...until I find it...
[14/15] Lari: ...goodbye. Goodbye until the day comes when I can fill you with light once more. Goodbye until you learn... Goodbye, until I can fix you...
[15/15] Lari: Goodbye, Dullahan... I'll miss you.
At this moment...I believed that I could protect her. I believed that I could aid her.
I left Aldorei behind, to aid in her ''battle'' against the darkness. What a fool I was.
As the darkness slowly seeped into the land, her stubbornness halted any progress we might have made.
Years of searching to no avail- A strong enough attack would have ended it, but her foolish pacifism doomed us.
Six hundred years of searching finally brought us to what we so foolishly sought... And we were unprepared.
The creature was found hibernating underground... It had been storing power, and we found ourselves utterly outmatched.
She had the power and the opportunity to kill it ten times over, but clung to her morals. She could not recognize necessity, and refused to heed my offers and warnings.
And so, my dark agony began. The light began to siphon away from me. I found myself paranoid and addled, fearful that my disfigurement would be seen.
Even still I held some misplaced faith in her. With that dark seed in my mind... It grew to an obsession, almost- I had to hide it. I had to hide my curse. But it was found...
The people of Gelibord saw my cursed visage... They saw me near the dark scars. They assumed without thought, and turned me into a perfect scapegoat.
Not even death saw the end of my misfortunes. Not even a final release such as this could save me from Lari's stubbornness and endless mistakes.
She brought me back...but the dark infection had eroded away my mind, my soul, my magic, and it continued to ravage my body. Every part of me, the dark touched.
Her soft light burned in me, as the darkness quashed it and filled in the emptiness that it had created. I was there...but you could not say I was the same person.
I could feel nothing. She still made me feel...but only annoyance. Rage. Sorrow. I could not bear to be with her a moment longer.
There is no fixing this. Her actions are doomed to failure, just as I saw. She has not returned since this time... And so she did not realize that her actions have done little.
The very powers she bestowed me with, knowingly or not...allow me to command spirits as I wish. To have those who doomed me to this purgatory feel the same aches as I have.
To have their minds, bodies, and souls wracked. To have their magic outlawed and wither in disuse.
Each soul I consume fills me with new strength. And none can reach me- Lari herself saw to that. Would she have taken action, had she known?
There is truly, finally, nothing more for you here. The spell can not be broken, as of now. You have seen my life laid bare in front of you. There is nothing more for you to see.
Leave. And do not return.

[10/52] Guardian of The Forest: To do something dark, you are about to say, and to that I say you have not.

[13/52] Guardian of the Forest: For a thousand years or more of your own thoughts, I understand that you are conflicted.
[14/52] Guardian of the Forest: However... You have, in that time, made a grave error. You have grown to realize an incorrect assumption.
[15/52] Guardian of the Forest: Dark and Light... They oppose. They clash. They create a cloying pox. But, allow me to ask.
[16/52] Guardian of the Forest: Is the axe evil for chopping the tree? Is the wood evil for resisting the metal?
[17/52] Guardian of the Forest: Are the flames evil for burning up the leaves? Is the water evil for dousing the fire?
[18/52] Guardian of the Forest: Is a victim evil for striking back against those that have struck them?
[19/52] Guardian of the Forest: And most importantly... Are any of these things light, or dark?
[20/52] Guardian of the Forest: What connection does a primordial force have with the moral leanings of mortals- or even immortals?
[21/52] Lari: ...you. You can't possibly be saying that what I did was the right thing to do. I refuse to accept that.
[22/52] Guardian of the Forest: I will not ask you to. You must understand that Orphion has no moral bearings- He simply needs action.
[23/52] Guardian of the Forest: What you have done may not have been the right thing, by anyone's account. However, it was necessary. You have thrown off your bonds, in a sense.
[25/52] Lari: ...then... Shouldn't I feel... I don't know. Shouldn't I feel less restrained? Less afraid? More... More free?
[26/52] Lari: If what I've done was what needed to happen, why do I feel like the scum of the earth? Why do I feel so terrible?!
[27/52] Guardian of the Forest: I admit, such a thing is a conundrum. I agree that it is a tragedy to kill, in many instances.
[28/52] Guardian of the Forest: Yet when such an action could save the lives of others, it becomes a conundrum with no answer. An impossible value to weigh.
[29/52] Guardian of the Forest: Despite the circumstances, you have done the best you could. I cannot fault you for your thoughts and morals.
[30/52] Guardian of the Forest: And so... As you are now proven, as I am awoken, the gateway to the Light shall reveal itself to you. Lari... You must prepare for your journey to the Realm of Light.
[31/52] Lari: ...I... I need time to process this. I... Do you understand how difficult this is to hear? To bear?
[32/52] Guardian of the Forest: I do not blame you for it. By the time you have composed yourself, your ally will be ready. Understand that they are as necessary as you are.
[33/52] Guardian of The Forest: For now, soldier must learn what you have learned, of the nature of realms. They must know what you know if they are to aid you fully.
[34/52] Guardian of the Forest: I must ask you to pay close attention. I shall present it simply- though the enormity of this cannot be understated.
[35/52] Guardian of the Forest: Allow me to show you our reality, soldier. It is difficult to properly present its scale... So here is an approximation.
[36/52] Guardian of the Forest: This is our world, the world we stand in right now. The physical plane of existence.
[37/52] Guardian of the Forest: Only a select few are aware that there is more of the world than this. Even the astronomers and those who view the enormity of the sky cannot understand.
[38/52] Guardian of the Forest: For, you see, this realm, this plane- It is mirrored upon a second plane, as the embodiments of Realms clash.
[39/52] Guardian of the Forest: This is the Plane of Influence, comprised of many realms. There are three you must know- But only one you must pay attention to.
[40/52] Guardian of the Forest: The Realms of Influence are connected to the physical plane, tied inexorably so to it. This is why even those gazing at the cosmos cannot grasp the enormity of it.
[41/52] Guardian of the Forest: These realms are in a constant push and pull- Battles that could not be seen by those of this world, waged constantly.
[42/52] Guardian of the Forest: However, they can be felt. Wide-scale changes to the balance of one realm or another are reflected on the physical plane.
[43/52] Guardian of the Forest: The Realms of Influence are, themselves, reflections of a Beast- They themselves, a physical manifestation of their realm, as their realm is a manifestation of them.
[44/52] Guardian of the Forest: So surely, you must know- As Gavel has decayed, it must mean that the Realm of Light is in peril, and thus that Orphion is, as well.
[45/52] Guardian of the Forest: The Light is infected- That abominable parasite has breached the Realm of Light, and sought Orphion to leech away his light.

[46/52] Guardian of the Forest: And so, as the sun is forced to set, the land of Gavel grows dark. As the dark parasites spread and devour the minds of those here, so too is Orphion subject to this torture.
[47/52] Guardian of the Forest: The balance shifts, and Orphion grows weary. Angered, desperate. He called to you as a last plea- and you have done admirably, for what he has asked of you.
[48/52] Guardian of the Forest: Now, you must enter the Realm of Light, and aid Lari in purging the parasite, before its work is finished and Orphion's mind is consumed.
[49/52] Guardian of the Forest: You must ready yourself before this, of course. To venture to another realm is a lofty task.
[50/52] Guardian of the Forest: I will bestow upon you two things that will surely aid you in this, however. First, I shall provide you the way to the Gateway to Light.
[51/52] Guardian of the Forest: Once you have reached it, I shall bestow upon you a personal blessing of mine, in the hopes that your path will become clear.
[52/52] Guardian of the Forest: Enter the portal, soldier. I shall show you the Gateway to Light... And I shall wish you luck.

[1/7] Dereg: Oh, you look tough. You must be one of those humans I keep hearing about, right? People talk about your kind all the time.
[2/7] Dereg: You know, that you're all scrappers. Tough as nails, and willing to kill all sorts of beasts, you know?
[3/7] Dereg: I think you know what I'm getting at. I saw some massive thing lumbering around the swamp one night! Tall as the trees, it was.
[4/7] Dereg: I couldn't make out the details, but if its size was any indication, it could just step over the Olux walls and wreck the whole town!
[5/7] Dereg: Of course, there's so many scam artists around here trying to sell anti-monster underwear or whatever that no one believes me.
[6/7] Dereg: So, that means it's up to you! Ehm, supposing that you're willing to help out, at least... The one thing I know for sure is that it was eating something.

[7/9] Tolem: Okay, this can work, this can work! I have to figure out how to fix this, and some of my cows ran off in a panic.
[8/9] Tolem: So, you can take care of them while I re-plan my fencing. Simple enough, right?
[9/9] Tolem: Three of my cows ran off. Look around the farm for them. They were eating, so look for fallen wheat on the ground!

[11/11] Tolem: You're going to help me get at least one thing around here working. You get the wood, I'll keep looking over the fencing.
[1/4] Tolem: Oh lovely. Idiot's back! Joy of joys. Willow planks, please.

[4/4] Tolem: So go on, get out of here now. Make yourself useful and follow the giant footprints in the ground. Hunt something that NEEDS hunting, instead of cattle!

[7/8] Zhight: I! I mean! Nothing, nothing! Just, ehm, our extra reliable supplier often stops by Mage Island for supplies...
[8/8] Zhight: S-So, if you just happen to stop by there after your lovely stay here, and tell him to get off his sorry butt and send me my supplies that'd be just peachy!

[2/9] Phief: I do hope he isn't mad at me. I fully intended to bring the supplies to him.
[3/9] Phief: But things took a turn for the worst quickly, and I no longer have access to my ship.
[4/9] Phief: A madman jumped onto my ship, overpowered me, and held me hostage!
[5/9] Phief: He was telling me how he wanted to "take back what was stolen from him", and it looked like he was heading to Maro Peaks.
[6/9] Phief: I have no clue whether he was deranged, paranoid, or if someone really did take something from him.
[7/9] Phief: I am certain of one thing. Nobody is going to sail my boat but me. I took my first chance to escape, broke the controls.
[8/9] Phief: And I swam back to land, here. Problem is, I haven't exactly decided how I'll get the ship back for myself.
[9/9] Phief: Maybe you can help me with that. The ship should still be stuck, due north of here, it has a red and white sail. I'd love to get my sea legs back.
[1/9] Tirt: He told you what?! That fumbleknuckle...
[2/9] Tirt: We didn't steal the ship from Phief, we were taking back what he stole from us years ago!
[3/9] Tirt: He attacked us on our way home to Maro Peaks, kicked us off the boat, and sailed it to who-knows-where.
[4/9] Tirt: We didn't think we would ever get it back, until we started seeing him sailing to that doofbumble Zhight.
[5/9] Tirt: Luckily, he decided to claim an island so close to Maro Peaks, or else we would have never seen him.
[6/9] Tirt: My father started following him with a small sailboat he made, and decided on the perfect place to attack.
[7/9] Tirt: But then Phief just had to throw a hissy fit and leave us stranded here.
[8/9] Tirt: My father took a paddleboat back to Maro Peaks to gather supplies. He took the cargo the ship had with him.

[7/10] Ildan: He keeps reviving his minions and it's causing quite some problems to our army.

[10/10] Ildan: I've marked the direction to the shrine in your book. Remember, there should be hints right nearby the shrine. Good luck.

[3/8] Ildan: Oh, but before you go! I do have a few things to say. First, about the beads here.
[4/8] Ildan: The tribesmen accept these as currency, so if you collect enough, I've heard they can offer you powerful masks.
[5/8] Ildan: Second, about the shrine. Now, this is just a rumor, but apparently that tomb is not unique.
[6/8] Ildan: There are supposed to be a bunch of these altars scattered around the province, even in Gavel too!

[8/8] Ildan: Anyway, I've talked enough. I'm proud to have such a powerful fighter join our town! I wish you luck, friend!
