[2/10] Grandon: The book is actually a diary written by our ancestors decades ago. It is actually very interesting, how they remodeled almost the whole house.
[3/10] Grandon: Ferndor probably told you about the boots, right? The diary has some information about them...ah, here, on this page.
[4/10] Grandon: Here...our family bought them from "a dark and mysterious humanoid creature" a long time ago.
[5/10] Grandon: The boots were apparently so valuable that the creature as part of the deal, said they put some kind of spell on them, but that was a lie.
[6/10] Grandon: It was found that the boots themselves were horrendously powerful, imbued with dark magic that will deteriorate and decay everything around it over time.
[7/10] Grandon: They were given a special boot container with similar effects, but when the Galoshes are within the Container, they cancel each others' effects out.

[8/10] Grandon: They hid the boots in the mansion, along with the case. The writer of this diary wrote down some hints as to how to get to them, maybe you can find out what they mean. Here, try this one:
[9/10] Grandon: "The face above the hall owns the nose that needs to be heavier to open the way".
[10/10] Grandon: Hmm, all the hints appear in a chapter about this room, the dining hall. Any idea what this meant? It feels like it should be obvious, but I can't for the life of me figure this out.
[1/1] Grandon: "Throw something behind the map on the wall to uncover a piece of the code"? Wait, that probably means the code to the basement!
[1/7] Grandon: A room hidden underneath the big head? Why didn't I think of that!? I always wondered how self-centered they had to be to put that in, but who knew it actually had a valid purpose!
[2/7] Grandon: So, there was a sign telling you to look for stone in the corner? Hm...intriguing!

[3/7] Grandon: Whoever placed down that sign might have meant a secret way up to the second floor. It hasn't been accessible for a fairly long while, not since the stairs collapsed. Except for Leacen, but she's a bit crazy...
[4/7] Grandon: Anyway, seems they guessed that we would have to search for a way to return the boots, and made preparations. Good thing, that.
[5/7] Grandon: As I said, the stairs are all broken. I mean, I certainly couldn't climb up those rotten scraps of wood. Suppose it might be best to look for that stone, hm?
[6/7] Grandon: But where could it be...oh? Is this a hint? I just noticed this on the next page.
[7/7] Grandon: "The carpet of different colour will show you the stone to reveal the tables secret".
[1/6] Grandon: Sheesh! Quite the engineers, these old fellows! Never would've imagined any of this in the house. Anyway, was there a message? What did it say?
[2/6] Grandon: The hole nobody wanted? He can only mean the little rat hole in the back part of this hall. Though, it's more just a hole anymore, all the rats are gone.
[3/6] Grandon: Well, details, details. We never checked it any more than just laying mouse traps, so I suppose there could be something in there given how complex these contraptions have been.
[4/6] Grandon: I would say, you look into the hole and then search on top of the blue flags!
[5/6] Grandon: But if that's the way up to the second floor, what does the diary mean by this?

[6/6] Grandon: "Throw something behind the map on the wall to uncover a piece of the code"? Wait, that probably means the code to the basement! Come back to me at once when you've done that, I have more to tell you!
[1/5] Grandon: You found a piece of the code!? Hahah, excellent! I must say, you've made more progress in a few minutes than I have in a few years! You humans really are something!
[2/5] Grandon: Now, the diary now says you must make your way to the second floor to find the other 3 digits of the code.
[3/5] Grandon: Remember, to get up to the second floor you need to use the button in the rat hole to open the passage above the blue flags hanging from the ceiling.

[4/5] Grandon: It doesn't say where they are, just that they're well hidden and that there are additional clues around the house. The other 3 digits should all be up there on the second floor! Maybe Leacen has seen something about them while she's been up there, as well.
[5/5] Grandon: Once you've found the whole code, head to the basement. Just follow the path and signs outside the manor once you have it.
[1/5] Ferndor: So you have the container and the boots! I wish I would have gone with you...
[2/5] Ferndor: At least we can stop the manor's slow decay! Let me just put the boots into the container...
[3/5] Ferndor: That was easy. I still can not believe that such a small thing can cause so much trouble.
[4/5] Ferndor: Well, I can not just let you stand there without a reward, right?

[5/5] Ferndor: Here, how about some emeralds, and these boots? They're heirlooms given to my family by the Sodeta Guild who once owned this mansion. I promise they arent evil! Feel free to visit us at any time!
[1/1] Ferndor: Now that the boots are back in place, we only need to repair the mansion, and we can live normally again!
[1/2] Grandon: This building has such rich history, it would've been an absolute shame to have lost it over just a pair of silly old boots.
[2/2] Grandon: I mean, what would the Sodetas have thought? Well, I guess they probably wouldn't come all the way over from the Guild Hall to check anymore, but...still.
[1/10] Atisun: Oh, a human? If I could beg your pardon a moment... could I talk to you about the mansion here?
[1/1] Atisun: All you have to do, is go in there and find answers. I'm sure the past won't haunt us both. Something happened here all those years ago... I want to know what.
[1/3] Servant: Mr. Caritat is always writing so intensely in that book... I do wonder what he could be saying.
[2/3] Timmy: He won't even tell me what he's writing.
[3/3] Maid: I'll bet he's writing insults about us or something. He can't be as nice as he appears, no one is!
[1/4] Timmy: I accidentally dropped my Library Key down the drain, do you think my dad will be angry?
[2/4] Maid: Come on, Timmy. Mr. Caritat is crazily sweet. I doubt he'd be upset, even if you'd thrown it down there on purpose.
[3/4] Timmy: I still want to find the key though, do you know where I should look?
[4/4] Servant: Well, the drainage pipes have probably taken the key to the basement in the southeast corner of the mansion by now, that's most likely where it is.
[1/3] Maid: I've heard about weird things happening around the house. People are saying the mansion might be haunted!
[2/3] Servant: Ghosts? Preposterous! This mansion isn't haunted, don't believe those silly rumors!
[3/3] Timmy: G-g-ghosts?!
[1/1] Maid: It's so kind of the Caritats to donate these supplies to the struggling people in the forest.
[1/2] Timmy: I've forgotten, where should I look for my Library Key?
[2/2] Servant: The drainage pipes have probably taken the key to the basement in the southeast corner of the mansion by now, you should check there.
Page 1: Today was my first day as the butler for the Caritat family. They gave me quite a warm welcome. I think I'm going to like it here.
Page 2: The Caritats are as nice as people say. They're some of the kindest people I've ever met, let alone work for.
Page 3: That Timmy boy has been acting rather unusual lately... Uncharacteristically hostile. I wonder what's come over him.
Page 4: I've been hearing strange noises at night. Scratching, and sometimes yelling... I do hope nothing bad is going on.
Page 5: I don't even know how this happened, but Timmy performed dark magic. He shot a fireball! The north wall of the library was wrecked!
[1/7] Mister Caritat: Timmy, is something bothering you? You have been acting so weird lately.
[2/7] Timmy: You cannot command me, mortal! You and all of your inferior species will bow to the darkness!
[3/7] Mister Caritat: I dont know what game you are playing, Timmy. But I will not stand for it any longer, snap out of it!
[4/7] Timmy: You shall pay for your insolence, mortal!
[5/7] Mister Caritat: Dark magic? What foul books have you been reading? And what's that in your hand?
[7/7] Timmy: That is an item beyond you, mortal. Give it back to me this instant!
[1/6] Mister Caritat: Attention, attention everyone! I have an announcement I'd like to make!
[2/6] Mister Caritat: My son, Timothy, has just turned eighteen today.
[3/6] Mister Caritat: Now, there have been a few slight hiccups over the years, but we've made it through mostly in one piece.
[4/6] Mister Caritat: And I'd like to say, I'm very proud of him. To Timothy, a new man!
[5/6] Timothy: Thank you very much, Father, and everyone here. Here's to more years of health-
[6/6] Mister Caritat: Please, everyone stay calm. I'm sure it's just the cooks spilling something...
[1/2] Baker: Oh my god... what is that thing?!
[2/2] Chef: Everyone out, now! We can't fight these things!
[1/9] Mr. Caritat: My god... What is wrong with this place? No matter what I do, what I try...
[2/9] Timothy: How was any of that even possible? What are we going to tell their families?
[3/9] Mr. Caritat: ...Timothy, I'm going to ask you something, and I need you to answer me honestly. Were you... Were you responsible for this?
[4/9] Timothy: No, of course not! I overcame that years ago, you know that, I can't believe you still suspect me of-
[5/9] Servant: Ah, sir, we did find something rather unusual in the kitchen that might interest you? Maybe?
[6/9] Mr. Caritat: What- Out with it! What did you find?! Please, please tell me I'm wrong!!
[7/9] Servant: We found this charred-looking black spoon. I've worked here for years, and I've never seen any spoons of this style in the mansion.
[8/9] Timothy: Wait, that spoon? I remember sneaking into your study that one time to get it, but how did it survive the fire?
[9/9] Mr. Caritat: Wait, you got it from my STUDY?! You... You idiot! Do you have any idea what you have done?! You must NEVER go in my study!!
Dear Anton, the chandelier fell in the main hall. Please fix it as soon as possible.
Page 1: DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH DEATH.
Page 2: There is a dark power beyond our control within this mansion. There is no use trying to fight it.
Page 3: I felt like all of the skulls were watching me. I have had to turn them all towards the fireplace.
[1/2] Mr. Caritat: THAT WHICH STARTED THIS WAR SHALL RISE ONCE MORE. FROM THE REALM OF SHADOWS, DECEIT AND PAIN.
[2/2] Mr. Caritat: FOREVER TRAPPED, FROM WHENCE IT CAME. THROUGH THE WEAK POINT BETWEEN REALMS IT. SHALL. RISE. AGAIN!
[1/8] Mrs. Caritat: Harold, please...
[2/8] Mrs. Caritat: Stop this madness...
[3/8] Mrs. Caritat: Harold...?
[4/8] Mr. Caritat: FROM SOILS OF DOOM THE SERVANT LAID
[5/8] Mr. Caritat: BREAK THROUGH THE REALMS TO THE LAND OF TRADE.
[1/14] Caritat Senior: No, no! I said three feet left, you absolute...
[2/14] Lari: Mr. Caritat! What are you doing?!
[3/14] Caritat Senior: What are you doing here, Elf? You need proper equipment to be on this site-
[4/14] Lari: Mr Caritat, you can't build a house here!
[5/14] Caritat Senior: I can do whatever I like here, I bought the land.
[6/14] Lari: You don't understand! This is where it came... this is where the darkness invaded!
[7/14] Caritat Senior: Don't be preposterous. I'm building here to show the people that there's simply nothing to worry about!
[8/14] Caritat Senior: Besides, even if there was something, now that Dullahan's gone, it'll go too.
[9/14] Lari: What?! He wasn't the one causing all this, it was-
[10/14] Caritat Senior: Well of course you would think that. You and him had some... history, didn't you?
[11/14] Lari: I... Please, Mr Caritat. You don't understand what you're doing...
[12/14] Caritat Senior: I am securing some prime real-estate right here. Oh... Perhaps that is why you're here?
[13/14] Lari: What? No, I-
[14/14] Caritat Senior: Trying to expand elven territories, are you?! Well, I'll be having none of that! Leave, before I have my men escort you!
[1/1] Atisun: Hey! Human! Are you alright?! Please, calm down, quit flailing around, you're safe!
[1/8] Atisun: Oh thank goodness, you're back to us. I was so worried... er, you might not recall. Let me explain...
[1/2] Arnod: Mmph! Humnym! Mah houfhs fhs om fifhre! Gft hfrelp, tiff brafze womd strfp!
[1/3] Arnod: ...well, that explains why you didn't help. But, uh, did the RAGING FIRE escape your notice somehow?!
[1/21] Axelus: Hm...where am I going to get help now- Mh? You're one of those human types, right? Do you have-
[2/21] Axelus: Huh? Someone's house is on fire? Guess that's a little more pressing than what I was going to ask. Where is it?
[3/21] Axelus: Oh, that valley by the gate? I think I know where you mean. Let's walk together. So, tell me what exactly happened?
[13/21] Axelus: Hm...didn't think they'd be this far out, but it'd make sense if...
[14/21] Axelus: Aha! Here's the problem. It's just a little Fleris. Ehm, to explain, they normally live in the Heights.
[15/21] Axelus: Pretty affectionate, good if you can stand the heat, but if you take them away from their mounds they get spooked.
[16/21] Axelus: One fleris could've kept setting this man's house on fire, but all the other fallout...there's certainly more where this one came from.
[17/21] Axelus: Let's go talk to the villager outside. He might've seen where the others got off to, or where they came from.
[18/21] Axelus: Sir, I figured out why your house kept re-igniting and solved that issue, but tell me, have you seen any moving sludgy things around here?
[19/21] Arnod: Uhm, I don't really know. I've been trying to douse my house so many times over that I haven't really paid attention!
[20/21] Arnod: I remember seeing some tar-looking stuff dripping from the mountains behind my house, but that's it!
[21/21] Axelus: Sounds concrete enough to me. Let's check out what's going on on top of the mountain ridge. Check that book of yours if you need directions.
[1/7] Axelus: Hm, you're a pretty quick climber. I thought I'd get ahead of you. Well, this looks like the scorched area down in the valley... Hm! I thought so.
[2/7] Axelus: There's only one reason I can think of that there would be so many Flerisi around here... If that wagon's reinforced, then...
[3/7] Axelus: Gah, I knew it. Traffickers! And incompetent ones, too, considering they couldn't hold the things.
[4/7] Axelus: There's a black market issue in the Molten Heights. Things that you can't find anywhere else are harvested in the Heights for their high value.
[5/7] Axelus: Flerisi are one of them. In the Heights, they're kept as pets. They're relatively friendly, keep your house warm, and don't need much care...
[6/7] Axelus: ...But if you take them away from a warm place, they burn everything. To think- Some people use the things as weapons. Can't leave well enough alone...
[7/7] Axelus: We'll need to catch these flerisi. Here, take this net. While you catch them, I'll repair the cart so we can put them in there later.
[1/7] Axelus: I've got the cart all repaired and ready, did you get all the Flerisi? Come over to the cart then. We still have work to do.
[2/7] Axelus: I'll keep the Flerisi in a smaller fire to keep them calm, see if I can't get them back to the Heights when this is done.
[3/7] Axelus: For now, I want to see if I can find anything on who these traffickers were. Let's see if they left anything in the front of the cart.
[4/7] Axelus: ...oh. Well, didn't notice that the fires went THAT far earlier. That's a problem, isn't it?
[5/7] Axelus: To explain, Flerisi aren't all as tiny as the ones we've found here. They feed off cinders and fire... And for this much damage to be caused, well...
[6/7] Axelus: Methinks this one's getting a bit out of control. This is right next to that big forest, too. Could be a problem if we leave this one be.
[7/7] Axelus: We're going to have to track it down and subdue it. Here, follow me. I'll dig us down to the valley. Watch a dwarf at work!
[1/2] Axelus: Not bad, eh? Anyways, dunno what that huge gate's for, but it looks like our Fleris friend has commandeered it for a bonfire.
[2/2] Axelus: At least it's a little more contained than I thought, being in that cave, but we still have to catch it. Lead the way. I'm right with you.
[1/1] Axelus: What the...?! It inflamed the creatures in this cave! Fend 'em off!
[1/1] Axelus: There are more of them coming! Get to the end of the cave!
[1/4] Axelus: Gah, more?! Behind you!
[1/1] Axelus: Hey! Back up! Don't approach the enemies!
[2/4] Axelus: Both of us stopping is going to make it take too much time, the traffickers might come back!
[3/4] Axelus: Listen up. I'll handle these things, while you go after the Fleris. If it's a big one like we think, it'll be a downhill battle- It should shrink if you attack it!
[4/4] Axelus: Alright, time for a little royal rumble!
[1/2] Axelus: Phew, you're alright! Charred and covered in soot, but that's to be expected. Subdued the Fleris, too! I have the net with me, so allow me.
[2/2] Axelus: Well, this is probably a bit of thankless work we just did, but so is a lot of work. Let's get out of here. We can talk outside.
[1/4] Axelus: Well, I say the work is thankless, but that won't stop me, anyways. Thank you for the help, human- This would've been overwhelming alone.
[1/10] Garull: GWUH! Oh god, don't scare me like that! Who... Who even are you?!
[1/4] Garull: Thank you for listening to me about not being so quiet coming over here. I'm guessing you've got everything?
[1/3] Garull: Oh, a visitor? Interesting. I thought I only knew about this cave, considering I was called crazy by my master.
[1/6] Garull: Ah, need help about the items? I'm fine with giving you a refresher, yeah.
[1/2] Garull: If you see Kelight again, tell him "I told you so" about the Creepers!
[1/6] Jorkin: You may want to get out of here, traveller. The Nether is very dangerous!
[1/7] Jorkin: You have the Light Dust, then? Hand it here, I want to see something.
[1/5] Kelight: I see you want to enter this mighty temple! Do not deny it, I see it in your eyes.
[2/5] Kelight: It is only natural, after all, to want to join the esteemed ranks of the Legends, such as myself!
[3/5] Kelight: However, as a Legend, I am very busy, autographs and the sort, and that's not to mention my guard duty! Let me see if you are even worth my time.
[4/5] Kelight: Hm... At a glance, you don't look anything special! Why, you may as well be a common soldier, for all I can imagine!
[5/5] Kelight: Tell me, why should I bother giving you this chance? Because thus far, I'm not impressed.
[1/1] Kelight: Hm? What are these oddities you have with you? Curious, yet useless. Allow me to dispose of them for you.
[1/1] Kelight: Indeed. Now, run along. Return when you have something truly impressive to show me.
[1/2] Kelight: So you return! Very interesting. That certainly puts you a level beyond any others who have tried... But it is not enough.
[2/2] Kelight: So? Tell me, why should I bother giving you this chance? Because thus far, I'm not impressed.
[1/2] Kelight: You're stubborn? Hah! Don't make me laugh. Do you think you are the first to attempt entry without anything great to show for it?
[2/2] Kelight: Of course you aren't. Run along, now. Return when you have something truly impressive to show for yourself.
[1/2] Kelight: So you are! And so am I. You will not get past me that easily, I'm afraid.
[2/2] Kelight: Off you go, then. Don't come back unless you have something to show!
[1/9] Kelight: Yes, I am starting to get that impression. You are such a headache, you know that?
[3/9] Kelight: Fine! Fine. I'll give you a chance. I'm certain you won't succeed, but anything to get you to stop bothering me.
[4/9] Kelight: Ahem. Hidden deep within a nearby cave is a beast beyond compare. Corrupted, yes, but nothing like the foes you may have faced before.
[5/9] Kelight: Rumor has it this creature was one of the miners which first ventured into the Nether Portal... Of course, as a Legend, I would usually disregard such things.
[6/9] Kelight: In any case, its power cannot be understated. Simply entering its cave will greatly weaken you, even with the best equipment!
[7/9] Kelight: Getting close to it would quickly corrupt you, which is why you will need protection. Only a light whose origin is from the same realm from which the beast arrived will do the trick.
[8/9] Kelight: As such, your very first step on your journey to become a Legend will be... to visit a friend of mine who studies the Nether.
[9/9] Kelight: His name is Jorkin, and he knows more about that realm than anyone else I know. Find him in the Roots of Corruption, and request his aid. Tell him I sent you.
[1/2] Kelight: ...And? Surely you do not hope to bribe me, do you? What use would I have for whatever meager wealth you have?
[2/2] Kelight: I'm a Legend! I have everything I could possibly need for the rest of my life! Now, run along. Return when you have something concrete to show me.
[1/2] Kelight: Ha! You? A Legend?! What a joke. You aren't the first to have tried that, by the way. I know each and every member of our ranks, and you are not one of them.
[2/2] Kelight: Ah, truly, being a gatekeeper of the Temple is an entertaining position. Run along, now. Return when you have something real to show me.
[1/16] Kelight: Hmph. Ridiculous. I don't need you to convince me of anything! Clearly, you are nothing but a pretender.
[2/16] Kelight: Run along, now. If you don't have anything to show for yourself, don't waste my time!
[5/16] Kelight: ...But- ah. Since you are still here. Perhaps- no, no, don't be ridiculous, Kelight.
[7/16] Kelight: Come on, Kelight, don't do this, you can't just let them get you with the silent treatment...
[9/16] Kelight: Oh, fine. You've got me interested. What is special about you? You look like a common soldier, and yet...
[10/16] Kelight: Very well. I will allow you to attempt the trial. Perhaps, then, you will be able to prove yourself.
[11/16] Kelight: Hidden deep within a nearby cave is a beast beyond compare. Corrupted, yes, but nothing like the foes you may have faced before.
[12/16] Kelight: Rumor has it this creature was one of the miners which first ventured into the Nether Portal... Of course, as a Legend, I would usually disregard such things.
[13/16] Kelight: In any case, its power cannot be understated. Simply entering its cave will greatly weaken you, even with the best equipment!
[14/16] Kelight: Getting close to it would quickly corrupt you, which is why you will need protection. Only a light whose origin is from the same realm from which the beast arrived will do the trick.
[15/16] Kelight: As such, your very first step on your journey to become a Legend will be... to visit a friend of mine who studies the Nether.
[16/16] Kelight: His name is Jorkin, and he knows more about that realm than anyone else I know. Find him in the Roots of Corruption, and request his aid. Tell him I sent you.
[1/1] Kelight: Well? You've been given a task, haven't you? Don't come back until you've retrieved the light you'll need for protection.
[1/9] Kelight: Hah. Took you long enough! This is the light dust, I presume?
[2/9] Kelight: I'll hold on to this for now. While it is a vital ingredient for your protection, it is not enough on its own.
[3/9] Kelight: You'll need an item to focus the magic around yourself, preferably something you'd wear. Hm... How about a helmet? Certainly, it'd do wonders for your poor sense of style.
[4/9] Kelight: Ahem. As for creating it... I know only one man capable of crafting a piece of armor good enough to ensure your safety.
[5/9] Kelight: Unfortunately, he will be hard to reach. His name was Garull, and he was the finest craftsman I'd ever met! A bit on the eccentric side, though.
[6/9] Kelight: He was always ranting and raving about Creepers... he really thought they were real, can you imagine? What complete and utter nonsense.
[7/9] Kelight: When I suggested the notion to be absurd, he seemed upset by my comments, and stopped visiting. Truly, I don't know what I did wrong. What a ridiculous man.
[8/9] Kelight: As it stands, I have no idea where you could find him. He spoke of wanting to research the Pigman Ravines several times, though none of our rank have ever seen him there.
[9/9] Kelight: In any case, it is somewhere to begin your search! Should you manage to find him, and convince him to craft you the helmet, return here and we can proceed.
[1/5] Kelight: ...Hm? Oh, it's you again. Did you manage to actually find the blighter? Good to know he isn't dead, at least.
[2/5] Kelight: You have the helmet, I presume? Hand it over, here. I'll quickly apply the light dust. Then, you'll be able to enter the cave.
[3/5] Kelight: Hopefully you'll do better than that last group that tried to fight it. Six fighters strong... never came back.
[4/5] Kelight: ...Well, good luck! I'm certain you'll either succeed, or you'll fail spectacularly. Either or, really.
[5/5] Kelight: Bring me concrete proof of your triumph over the beast, and I will grant you passage into the Temple of the Legends! Do be quick, would you?
[1/4] Kelight: ... You... You did it? H-how?!
[2/4] Kelight: Even one so brave and powerful as myself could not possibly survive against-
[3/4] Kelight: Er... I mean, of course you were able to defeat the beast! I believed in you from the very start!
[4/4] Kelight: ...Ehm. I suppose you are welcome in the Temple of the Legends, now! You have... certainly proven yourself. My apologies for misjudging you. Feel proud of your accomplishment!
[1/1] Kelight: I am proud to have you in our temple! Perhaps one day you shall be almost as great as I am!
[1/2] Kelight: Only the bravest adventurers who succeed in my quest can enter the temple of the legends.
[2/2] Kelight: Only brave warriors of level 68 may attempt to join this temple.
[1/6] Rayshyroth: Oh? Well, greetings. What brings you to our quiet lonely island, let alone all the way up here?
[1/9] Rayshyroth: Aha, you're back with the Sky Vapor! Sorry about the climb, even I find it rather inconvenient at times.
[1/5] Monte: Oh, what am I to do...? How am I to be our next elder if I cannot even help him... Oh? Ehm, hello, stranger.
[2/5] Monte: You most likely heard me. Our elder has fallen ill of some vile disease... I am to be our next elder, but I am not yet ready.
[3/5] Monte: We have tried everything we can think of, but our healers and shamans have failed to cure him. We had some hope, however...
[4/5] Monte: A man in your city, Troms, insists that he sells healing water that could cure him, but he is selling it for an exorbitant price that we cannot afford!
[5/5] Monte: I do not know where else to turn. I must ask you for help. If you can purchase it, I am sure that we could find a way to repay you.
[1/6] Salesman: Oh, why hello there! Come for my patented healing water, have you? Any problem instantly cured! Sniffles beware!
[2/6] Salesman: You're quite lucky, I only have a couple of bottles left, so it won't go cheap, but this is the good stuff! Only [64 Liquified Emeralds]!
[3/6] Salesman: What? Don't give me that look! This is the real stuff, very valuable and rare! What do ya take me for, some guy who'd sell lake water for a fortune?!
[4/6] Salesman: Agh, agh! Put away the weapon! Put it away! Jeez, buddy! Alright, I admit it, I'm a fraudster! But, I do know where you get the real stuff, I ain't lying about that much.

[6/6] Salesman: I doubt you'll have any better luck with it, but go on, try your luck.
[1/6] Isfurus: Hm, hm...if it really does that, then...oh, is someone there? Erisk?

[3/6] Isfurus: Hm...ah. Iboju's sister settlement...I see. I will trust this is an honest venture, then. The tribesmen are honourable.
[4/6] Isfurus: I will provide you a specially-prepared bottle to hold the water in. My colleague, Erisk, is within the fountain here. He can fill up the bottle for you.
[5/6] Isfurus: There are a few animals in the fountain, however. They're wild and will most likely attack, but you look well-armoured. I doubt you'll have trouble.
[6/6] Isfurus: The entrance to the heart of the fountain is right below us. Take a deep breath and dive right in.

[3/4] Erisk: But what a marvel this place is...water to cure all ailments, even aging! I even hear there is a similar fountain someplace in Gavel, can you believe?

[1/6] Cinfras: Hey there adventurer, can I speak with you for a second? I need you to do a spot of detective work for me.
[2/6] Cinfras: My grandfather once told me how beautiful this place was, and how to visit here if I wanted to relax.
[3/6] Cinfras: But as you can see, this island is the least bit relaxing. It is a sorrowful place, corrupted and dark.
[4/6] Cinfras: This can't be right. My grandfather was an honest man, he wouldn't have lied.
[5/6] Cinfras: I figure something must have happened. I really want to know how it got like this.
[6/6] Cinfras: There's an old creepy man living up on that hill in a big mansion who seems just old enough to know what happened. It might be a good place to start.
[1/7] Old Siwel: What do you want? I'm busy. Brewing potions takes focus, you know....
[2/7] Old Siwel: Oh, you want to know about the island's history? Well you certainly came to the right man. I've lived here for a very long time.
[3/7] Old Siwel: There is a way for you to see for yourself what happened here. It's quite... an interesting tale, too.
[4/7] Old Siwel: I'd sit and tell you, but I feel you might get a better experience first hand....
[5/7] Old Siwel: Using some of the more... frowned upon methods in the alchemists library I am able to send you into the 'memory' of a dead person that lived here at the time.
[6/7] Old Siwel: It will require a little work from you though, if you wish to proceed....
[7/7] Old Siwel: Bring me [3 Umbral Essences] and I will be able to cast a spell on you which will allow you to pass into the 'memory' of the deceased.
[1/9] Old Siwel: Excellent. You acquired the ingredients. Just give me a second and I'll prepare you for your journey into the mind of the dead.
[2/9] Old Siwel: *Mumbles a strange, dead language...*
[3/9] Old Siwel: *Mumbles a strange, dead language....*
[4/9] Old Siwel: There, look into my eyes. Yes, you're ready. Ah, there is a drawback though....
[5/9] Old Siwel: Once you are inside the memory, it will feel like you are actually there. You won't be able to return until you have succeeded in your task.
[6/9] Old Siwel: To enter the memory, you need to find the dead man at the end of the crypt in the graveyard.
[7/9] Old Siwel: The dead roam those caves in heavy numbers, so watch your step.
[8/9] Old Siwel: Oh and one more thing, If you die in the memory, you die in reality too....
[9/9] Old Siwel: Best of luck....
[1/5] Siwel: Oh, hello there. Would you mind helping me with something for a second?
[2/5] Siwel: Recently, some strange things have been happening to the miners around here. New diseases, unexplained disappearances, and things like that.
[3/5] Siwel: The villagers have been getting very worried. So, in an attempt to protect the island, I bought a strange egg and placed it in a cave close to town.
[4/5] Siwel: The egg, however, isn't what I thought it was. It is producing monsters and giving off some sort of dark aura.
[5/5] Siwel: I want you to go check out that egg. See if you can get rid of whatever it is producing. Bring me [5 Monster Hides] as evidence.
[1/7] Siwel: You're back! Were you able to stop that egg?
[2/7] Siwel: No? Well, I guess we'll have to wait and see what it hatches into.
[3/7] Siwel: I see you got some rather rare dark monster hide. Maybe I could use those in a potion for something, maybe to prolong life.
[4/7] Siwel: Some of the villagers believe that it is unwise for myself to dabble in the dark arts, dealing with mysterious eggs and brewing potions of death.
[5/7] Siwel: I'll outlive them all, you'll see!
[6/7] Siwel: As for you, you have done what I asked. You may return to your personal affairs now.
[7/7] Siwel: Thank you for your work, though. Only time will tell what that egg will hatch into.
[1/8] Old Siwel: What? You... you made it back? Oh... Very well. Alchemy can be a... dangerous practice.
[2/8] Old Siwel: Anyone who tried to find out the island's history came to me at some point, and I sent them on a one way street to a memory. But not you....
[3/8] Old Siwel: So now you know my dreadful secret, I am racked with guilt and cursed with eternal life.
[4/8] Old Siwel: There is no need to fight me, I am suffering enough for what I... wrought on this island.
[5/8] Old Siwel: I could not destroy the egg. It hatched into a... monstrous beast that cursed this island until this very day.
[6/8] Old Siwel: A powerful warrior from... Ragni slew the beast, yet the island did not rejuvenate....
[7/8] Old Siwel: I leave the bones of the beast as a reminder of my failure, the destruction it brought still... lingers in the monsters it left behind.
[8/8] Old Siwel: So adventurer, now you have the knowledge of what I have done. You may tell the others down in the village, as it is no longer a secret.

Eileen, Eileen... That girl never listens to me! Her own mother!
Every day, I find books sticking out of the bookshelves! And she keeps on coloring random letters in them...
She told me that those are her favorite books, there's some sort of 'clue' in them for... something.
I can't comprehend her reasons for doing that... Can't she come up with something that's less of a nuisance for the maids?
Garvan... he worries me more and more by the day. My sweet, beloved Garvan.
I remember, at the beginning... Yorman had hired Garvan out of concern for this 'Decay' plaguing the land. We told him that he must find a cure for the Decay before it subjugated the entire forest.
Over time... Well, I suppose love can corrupt. How else would I have...
Fallen in love with Garvan and forsook my own marriage under the nose of my husband and my beloved daughter-
But I digress. Garvan's done great research on this Decay, but... recently, he's changed. Something's wrong with him.
His eyes are glazed and dull. His tone of voice is... disturbing. He's made very little progress on the cure we tasked him with, and... I don't know what to do.
I suppose... I should just leave him be for the time being. Surely me butting into his work would just make him even worse, no?
Besides, if he ever gets too bad, he lives just east of the manor. I can be there for him if I need to, right?

I've been hired by Yorman and Katarin Faltach to study and hopefully cure this ''Decay'' that's appeared recently. I'm quite excited to get to the bottom of this.
It looks like I'm finally settled in. The Faltach Family has been quite kind with giving me this laboratory to study in.
Where to start... where to start...
This Decay is interesting, to say the least. I've never seen anything like this before in all my years.
Simple plant life appears to wither even when given proper nutrients and conditions to grow. What little magic they usually contain appears to be sapped as well...
It's odd. the Decay doesn't violently alter whatever it touches, like a pestilence would... It appears to be removing something in a coordinated manner. Almost as if a living creature was doing this.
But what organism could be removing magic from the plant?
I've been trying to expose this piece of Kanderstone to different types of magical energy to see if I could reverse the effects of this Decay upon it.

If I can just find whatever energy the Decay is sapping from the forests, then in all probability... this Kanderstone will revert to Cobalt, the mineral that was found in this forest before it began its decline.
...What could it be, though? I've tried every sort of magic I can think of. Nothing is reversing the effects of the Decay.
I'm certain of it. The Decay is caused by the removal of magical energy. I just can't pinpoint what exactly, though...
Eheheheheheeh... I've found it. I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it
The source of the Decay.
Throughout the forest, especially in caves, one can find strange, parasitic creatures that specialize in living underneath the earth.
When I touched one of these creatures after capturing it... It was as if my skin began to shrivel. It... siphoned energy from my hand.
I gave the thing access to a few fresh plants from the Light Forest, and watched with awe. Within a few minutes, it rendered the plant into a state identical to that of Decay-afflicted life.
I was right. I was right I was right I was right I was right I was right.

These parasites are what are causing the Decay. This is no otherworldly force or pestilence, no. This is an assault created solely by magical creatures. I... should thank my new friends for this discovery.
I've decided to try and talk a little more with the villagers just down the hill. They're quite interesting...

It's odd, though... Most of them keep glaring at me every time I return from my business in Cinfras. This one farmer kept asking me what my thoughts on the Gerten War and the government's involvement with it...
I just explained that I was a scientist researching the effects of the Decay. I might have lied a little and said I was almost about to find a cure. One of them seemed interested in that...

I went to the secret study inside of the Faltach's basement to look at some texts about the war and the government out of curiosity. I believe those people were just freaks. I should stay away from them-
Huh?
Huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh?
What lies. Lies lies lies lies lies lies lies lies lies lies. I don't really mind those people.
I quite like them. Yes. Yes yes yes yes yes. They're trustworthy. I should have believed them from the start.
They'll help me.
...What the hell is my wife THINKING?? Defending Garvan, as much of a lunatic as he is??
The man's made so little progress in the past few years. At this point, it's just a waste of our wealth...
Why is she defending HIM?? She's always been like that, so hopeful and defensive of the scientist... what could she POSSIBLY see in him?
Unless... No. That is impossible. She is not... like that. Damn it, I might be in the need for some well-deserved sleep...
Hmmm... Odd. There's a lot to take in here related to Gavel's deceased monarchy. It's quite interesting, though there is nothing about the Gerten War.
There are a few philosophical books that dive deep into the divide that the Cinfrasian Uprising has caused within the province. Very... strong opinions indeed.
The Decay has certainly drowned out that conflict. I myself have never heard of any of this! Though again, I never was a lover of history in the first place.
Huh. One of the more recent books suggests something has resurfaced in Kander. Villagers are ordered to keep an eye on their neighbors...
I should ask Katarin about this. She'd likely know more than I about any remaining royal politics, no?
''You died at 6 o-clock that night. Only 4 people came to your funeral.
3 of them couldn't have cared less. The other person wept for 8 hours afterwards.''
It's more clear. Day by day. This pestilence. Clear. Clear.
The creatures that cause this... and their wellspring... are sent by something beyond my comprehension.
Yes. Yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes. The Decay has been... brought here by divine intervention.
Then... I will use the divine's sentries to cure this. Just as they suggested.
I will begin at my research outpost in that stone city of Lexdale. I'll bring her there.
And all of this will finally end. By a cure.

[2/2] Doan: Oh, let's keep going! Where can we go with that lead?
[1/1] Doan: Who's that on top of that platform?!
[1/8] Mechanic: The two of you have come real far for this, huh?
[2/8] Mechanic: Well, I can give you the answer to the stout and beer question! But you won't enter the Market just with that.
[3/8] Mechanic: You see, to enter the Market you'll need something to sell! And it won't be something you can exactly buy around here, if you get what I mean.
[4/8] Doan: We need something... illegal, right?
[5/8] Mechanic: Exactly! Luckily for you, I'm in a good mood. There's an airship docked close by. We'll be able to take it and I can help you get an item!
[6/8] Doan: Uh... What do you think, soldier? I really need that passport, and well...you could get something out of this too, right?
[7/8] Doan: ... Fine, we'll do it.
[8/8] Mechanic: Great! Follow me, it's not far.
[1/2] Mechanic: Wait! There are guards protecting the airship. Don't let them see you!
[2/2] Mechanic: They're near the edge... Push them off.
[1/2] Doan: Uhh... I'm sure they're fine, I'm sure that fall wasnt too big...
[2/2] Mechanic: Well, that's your only way inside! There are more guards up ahead. Take care of them without being seen, and we'll be in the clear!
[1/3] Mechanic: Well done! Let's get on the airship.
[2/3] Doan: Did you just... Push them all...?
[3/3] Mechanic: Buckle up! We're heading to the Sky Islands, there we'll be able to collect some dragonling eggs for you to sell at the Black Market!
[1/4] Mechanic: The island we're heading to is home to a Dragonling nest! They use it to lay their eggs, as it's quite a difficult place to access.
[2/4] Doan: And those'll be worth a lot in the Black Market, right...?
[3/4] Mechanic: They sure will! Dragonling eggs are rare, and this island can only be accessed by airship... They're worth a fortune back at Letvus.
[4/4] Mechanic: Oh, there it is! I can see the island from here, buckle up. We've got some eggs to steal!
[1/1] Doan: What's that?! Oh... It looks like we've got company...
[1/2] Mechanic: Drat, the skyraiders are here! We can't let them get away with those eggs...
[2/2] Mechanic: Well, if that's the case, then there's only one thing to do! Come on, follow me!
[1/1] Mechanic: We can't get to the nest with so many pirates on the way, kill them!
[1/4] Mechanic: Alright, follow me! Let's go harvest that egg!
[2/4] Mechanic: Protect me while I harvest the egg, soldier!
[3/4] Mechanic: We're halfway there, just keep defending me!
[4/4] Mechanic: There we go! Let's get back to the airship, run!
[1/2] Skyraider: Don't let them get away! Fire the cannons!!
[2/2] Mechanic: Soldier, don't let them hit us! Attack the cannonballs using your weapon before they hit our airship to deflect them!
[1/2] Skyraider: We can't take more cannon shots... We're wasting our time, let's get going! We got bigger fish to fry!
[2/2] Mechanic: That was close... Well then, let's head back to the airbase!
[1/5] Mechanic: The two of you have certainly proven yourselves today!
[2/5] Mechanic: So, I'll give you the password to enter the Black Market.
[3/5] Mechanic: Go back to the Barman at the Inn and tell him 'I'm not thirsty, I always carry a bottle.'
[4/5] Mechanic: That might just give you the chance you need to get in. Good luck!
[5/5] Doan: Thank you for your help, sir... Let's go back to the bar, then.
[1/4] Doan: Here we are again. Let's talk to the Barman.
[2/4] Doan: Um, sir? I'm not thirsty, I always carry a bottle.
[3/4] Barman: Talk only to the Black Market member in the end of the hallway and do not talk to anyone else.
[4/4] Doan: Let's go, soldier.
[1/7] Market Member: I've heard you've stolen some eggs from the Skyraiders. That's a bold move!
[1/3] Doan: That's what we need, soldier. Sold! The egg is yours.
[3/3] Doan: Let's get our passports, soldier!
[1/5] Market Member: So do you have the emeralds?
[2/5] Market Member: Hmm... This will do it. Here, your passports.
[3/5] Doan: Uhh.. Soldier, I think you dropped your passport. Let me get it for yo-...
[4/5] Doan: Wait... That's MY passport?! It was in my pocket all along...
[5/5] Doan: Well, uhhh... I guess you can have some of these emeralds, then...
[1/1] Doan: ...Uh, soldier? I don't think we should leave this area yet, those must be the commanders the waiter mentioned over there.
[1/1] Doan: Remember what the passport seller said? We shouldn't always talk to the same merchant... I think this one won't like another price raise. We should talk to the others.
[1/1] Doan: We have to get to 2000 emeralds in 5 bid increases. Let's try again!
[2/3] Doan: So that's our intial bid. Now we need to ask for a higher bid, remember? We can't always talk to the same merchant or they'll lose interest...
[3/3] Doan: And we can't talk to more than 5 people for a raise or they might get angry.
[1/8] Dodegar: I'm glad you came along, I could do with a little help if you're not too busy.

[6/8] Dodegar: So firstly, I need some living wood for the handle, [1 Enchanted Stick] should be enough.

[8/8] Dodegar: I hope you are prepared, this will be your best quest yet!

[4/7] Captain Ackbar: Poor parenting, if you ask me. Alas, we must find the lad.

[2/6] Captain Ackbar: I really appreciate it. My crew seem to be absolutely nowhere!
[3/6] Captain Ackbar: OK, well the situation is pretty bad. The engines have broken down.
[4/6] Captain Ackbar: The engineer downstairs is trying to figure out a solution, but he's not the brightest villager in Gavel.
[5/6] Captain Ackbar: Would you mind having a talk with the engineer, and see i f you can help?
[6/6] Captain Ackbar: I have to stay here and man the brig, but if you head down to the engine room, we would greatly appreciate it.
[1/11] Captain Ackbar: Wow... You single handedly took out a skyraider invasion.
[2/11] Captain Ackbar: And you're a passenger! It's a good job you did...
[3/11] Captain Ackbar: We have no defense on this ship. We are a civilian carrier.
[4/11] Captain Ackbar: What is this? A ring from the Queen?! It looks valuable. You should keep it.
[5/11] Captain Ackbar: I still do not know how to thank you... We owe you so much.
[6/11] Captain Ackbar: Wait! I know! You can have free travel between Detlas and Cinfras!
[7/11] Captain Ackbar: A private airship owner called Calo owes me big.
[8/11] Captain Ackbar: I will tell him the deal. All you have to do is enter his ship and he'll take you back and for th!
[9/11] Captain Ackbar: Oh, and you will also be rewarded kindly monetarily. I will also personally send him the ring, so that it doesn't get damaged on the way, and you will receive it there.
[10/11] Captain Ackbar: Just head down to the entrance deck, and we are about to arrive at Detlas Airbase now.
[11/11] Captain Ackbar: Thanks for helping us, really!

[1/6] Psilo: Welcome, large human! What's that look for, never seen a Gnome before?! My house may look small, but it's perfect for me!
[2/6] Psilo: I actually need some help, you see Razorice plague my home! They are similar to the rats of your province, but vicious and deadly to Gnomes!
[3/6] Psilo: An easy fix exists for it though. There are many magical mushrooms in this cave and a rare one called Subtraxerim Utilium is the one we need.
[4/6] Psilo: It emits a sleeping spore that will knock the Razorice out long enough to kill them! Ive seen one in the cave but every time I go to get it, I fall asleep!
[5/6] Psilo: Since you're so big, you won't fall asleep! Please retrieve some mushroom for me.
[6/6] Psilo: I think I left a trail of rainbow spores last time I tried to collect some, just follow the colours through the cave to find the mushroom!
[1/7] Psilo: Did you find any? Wait, something is different about you. Have you gotten smaller? Oh my...
[2/7] Psilo: ... You have.
[3/7] Psilo: I'm really sorry about this, I didn't think the mushroom would have a different effect on humans! But what did I expect from a mushroom that changes colour?!
[4/7] Psilo: Do not panic. I have a mushroom in my house that wakes people up; logic says that if the sleeping mushroom shrinks you, then this one should make you grow again!
[5/7] Psilo: Oh my, you are still shrinking before my eyes. You must hurry to the mushroom. Be careful, though! The Razorice will probably hunt you!

[6/7] Psilo: I keep it on the top shelf, so you will probably have to fight them at some point... If you take care the razorice whilst you're there, we can kill two birds with one stone! Just follow the cheese crumbs to find them!
[7/7] Psilo: Good luck! Oh and, do watch out for my pet zombie.
[1/5] Psilo: What the... my house! What did you do?!
[2/5] Psilo: Springy plant? Bookshelf levers? Razorice king?! Hold on a moment, slow down and tell me properly.
[3/5] Psilo: I see. Well, at least you handled those damned Razorice, and I can actually live inside my house again - not that it'll offer much shelter now you've blown a hole in the side of it!
[4/5] Psilo: Ah, I suppose that's alright. The mushroom will grow back over to cover it - and righto,  your reward!
[5/5] Psilo: Here, take some of our Gnome gold, we have plenty to go around. And sorry about the whole you-getting-shrunk thing, but hey, being small isn't so bad! See you around, human!
[1/2] Psilo: Welcome, welcome! My humble little home welcomes travellers of all shapes and sizes!
[2/2] Psilo: However, the problem I'm having can't be solved by anyone under Level 76. Come back when you can!
[1/1] Psilo: Long time no see! Why you haven't grown, or shrunk, a bit since we last met.
[1/1] Cikal: Oh... you're a bit low level to be hanging around Gylia Watchtower, don't you think? Come back at level 77 and we'll get a drink down ya!
[1/1] Jitak: Hey there... if you're looking for a suit or something, now is a really bad time. Those blasted gerts keep taking my livestock!
[1/12] Cikal: Oh, ho ho. A human? What brings you to Gylia Watch - want to let your hair down a bit, I bet!
[2/12] Cikal: Of course you know who we are! The Gylia Watch was founded over 200 years ago in wake of the Villager victory in the war.
[3/12] Cikal:  The Gerten war! Only the most famous war in all of modern Gavel! The might of the Villagers crushed those blasted Gerts - not that they were particuarly hard to beat, heh.
[4/12] Cikal: Gerts are stupid brutes, you see. The only thing they ever think about is food.
[5/12] Cikal: Get too close to one and it'll chomp your fingers off, quick as you like. And then the rest of you as well!
[6/12] Cikal: The peace treaty keeps them inside their borders, and we get a delivery of supplies every month from Cinfras to send over to them.
[7/12] Cikal: Of course, we have to keep some of the supplies for ourselves - you've seen how hard these men are working, they deserve a bit of a party!
[8/12] Cikal: The Watch keeps a lookout over the Gerten borders day and night... well, maybe not on poker nights!
[9/12] Cikal: Although... we have heard a couple nasty rumours floating about - farmers disappearing from their houses and the such.
[10/12] Cikal: If I really can't tempt you with a glass of wine and a round of poker, maybe you could go and check them out for us?
[11/12] Cikal: I'd send the men, but... well, I'd feel bad if one of them went and missed all the partying!

[1/1] Marden: Round up, fellas! There's an uninvited guest barging in!

[5/7] Marden: All the cargo, all the correspondence, it could've easily gone up in flames. I don't think the fellow was thinking straight- they just really wanted that airship downed.
[6/7] Marden: Didn't even notice the great big hole in the sack they put the letters in. Theres stray papers all over the ground. We have confidentiality with them, but...

[2/9] Dorroc: Yes, I've seen quite a few of your type to this bazaar- Using the community forges and smithing tables and all. You all seem to have metals in bulk...

[6/9] Dorroc: ...but to wield it is to channel the power of Ockar the Unseen Blade himself! The wartime taskmaster who cowed a hundred demons with a mere dagger!
[7/9] Dorroc: Sneaking behind the lines of the enemy, braving blistering heat! Remaining as a shadow, and cutting through sheer earth and magma without flinching!!

[9/10] Lodog: Ah, but I'm gettin' away from myself. Tell ya what- prob'ly went through a lotta trouble ta get this, and that means you got guts. You got bravery. You got STONES, human!

[1/6] Dobile: Oh, you really are interested in hearing about those bottlecaps, huh? Well! Sit down there, fella! These have a STORY behind 'em.
[2/6] Dobile: See, almost all our drinks come in bottles. Bottles are just too useful, compared to cups or mugs. Good for improvised weapons, and so reusable!
[3/6] Dobile: These bottlecaps were the first specialty ones made in Dwarven history! Someone got the idea, since the Dogun festival was a big event, to make decorative bottlecaps.
[4/6] Dobile: Each one tells some of the story of the Dogun war on it, or some war trivia! See, this one tells you Delinaed the Wises favorite book.
[5/6] Dobile: It became a fad, then a tradition- practically every big Dwarven event has specialty bottlecaps made to commemorate it now. Collectors like me have our work cut out for us!
[6/6] Dobile: So hey, if you ever go to a big Dwarven event, buy some drinks! Save up those caps- they're worth a hundred times their weight in emeralds, in terms of historical value!
[1/6] Dorroc: Oh, I see that look in your eyes. That curiosity. You want me to unravel a mystery for you! Well, I can tell you this much...
[2/6] Dorroc: If I'm being honest, Jaspilite isn't much good for weaponry. It's more of a good-luck charm than anything- I plan to stud a blade with this instead of using it for the base.

[4/6] Dorroc: It's almost like if that hero you have...what was his name, John? Bob? Joe? I can't quite recall, the name, but it's something like that...
[5/6] Dorroc: It's like if he carved a good-quality training blade out of some vaguely rare, but otherwise mundane wood and used it to defend the citadels for decades.

[6/6] Dorroc: The wood itself is just wood...but it was used by a hero, so it must be special, yes? So Jaspilite is well sought-after. I once again thank you for liberating it from that stubborn bottlecap man.

[1/8] Mastro: MY EYES STING FROM THE HEAT OF YOUR DETERMINATION! Yes! Such passion flowing from you, now that you've experienced a treasure of EQUAL HEAT!
[2/8] Mastro: It's only right you learn more! My PRIDE! My SWEAT! My MUSCLED MIGHT! My WAY OF LIFE- Ardent Magma Crystals!
[3/8] Mastro: Gold makes the world turn! But nearly every piece of gold you see- is impure! There are imperfections in it, no matter how brilliant the luster!
[4/8] Mastro: But through HARD WORK! EXTREME HEAT! RIGHTEOUS SMITHING SKILL! It can be purified to shine like it was ALWAYS meant to! Shine like your SOUL!
[5/8] Mastro: The process is only for the STRONG! It takes months upon months of work- single mistakes can destroy the gold! But nothing worth doing in life is easy!
[6/8] Mastro: TRUE MEN will not give up! To be a man requires nothing of the body- it only requires a BLAZING SPIRIT! A weak body can be HONED! An impure metal can be PURIFIED!
[7/8] Mastro: Ardent Magma Crystals are the PUREST of gold! I have perfected my craft- each one takes a seasons worth of time, but such patience only practices my own PASSION!
[8/8] Mastro: And with my gift to you, we are truly BOUND by our spirits, however fleetingly! Carry yourself with grace, friend- and with POWER! HEAT! SWEAT! AND TEARS OF FLAME!!!
[1/9] Dohstaj: ...you again? Something up?
[2/9] Dohstaj: ...you know...I feel...passionate. Let me talk for a bit.
[3/9] Dohstaj: Flameshooters... Dogun weapons. Real common to find. But theyre just hilts with buttons on them.
[4/9] Dohstaj: They shoot out flames like a blade... Its been millenia since they were made.
[5/9] Dohstaj: ...almost impossible to repair, too. Youd need Dogun magic. And Doguns are gone, mostly.
[6/9] Dohstaj: ...but almost impossible means it can be done. I found it broken, and fixed it myself.
[7/9] Dohstaj: ...oh, Mastro... Hes my inspiration. Spends his life making those crystals... Does the impossible on a regular basis.
[8/9] Dohstaj: ...Ive done it once. Just cant compete.
[9/9] Dohstaj: ...least Ive got a little bit of him now.
[1/7] Syni: Finally, I can pack my things up and leave! I just need to endure this macho insanity til then... Thank you, human, for freeing me from this hell!
[2/7] Syni: Though...suppose you wouldnt know the history behind that staff, would you...I can pack and talk at the same time, why not.
[3/7] Syni: That staff belonged to the Dwarven king, Draani Thunderwill I. He started the colonization efforts in the Molten Heights, you see.
[4/7] Syni: He led the war efforts against the demons that crawled from the stone- the ones that used the very same weapon that you so graciously provided me, as a matter of fact!
[5/7] Syni: That staff was presumed lost in the great battle against the demon god, Garaheth...but I found it! It was snapped into something like ten pieces...
[6/7] Syni: That thing took me four years to repair. Its good as new now- it can even channel lightning just like the legends. An effort well worth the trouble!
[7/7] Syni: But the Dogun magic fascinates me- Ive got to figure out how those Flameshooters work! Ill bet I can reverse-engineer them, I just need a working model...and now I have it!
[1/13] Yansur: I see another challenger has found their way to The Qira Hive!
[2/13] Yansur: I can't say I am overwhelmed by your appearance. Here, the birth of many powerful and magical monsters take place.
[3/13] Yansur: Gavel's governments can not stop Mistress Qira. I doubt you can either.
[4/13] Yansur: If you want to meet her, you will have to defeat each division of her army.
[5/13] Yansur: Although powerful, she is not without honour. After every floor you complete, you will receive a token for a reward from the shop. Good luck, adventurer-

[7/13] Yansur: Wh- Oh, Mistress, am I? My apologies...
[8/13] Qira: You will be disciplined later...fine. Consider yourself honoured to have even a moment of my time, adventurer. Allow me to explain in further detail, my glorious Hive.
[9/13] Qira: As Yansur explained, if you wish audience with me, you must prove yourself worthy of my presence by defeating each division of my personal army.
[10/13] Qira: It consists of five main divisions, each one based around a particular element. Thunder, Air, Earth, and so on. Clearing one will unlock the next for you to face.
[11/13] Qira: To pass a floor of the division, defeat my forces and put the catalysts they drop into the collector. You will need five catalysts to pass a floor.

[12/13] Qira: After nine floors of normal troops, you will face a Division Leader. These exceptionally powerful members of my army will be fought alone, and you will only need one catalyst from them to pass.
[13/13] Qira: The Thunder Division will be your first challenge. I do hope you will be entertaining to watch...
[1/1] Qira: Begin, the Thunder Division! Strike quickly and move on, for those within will warp your very mind should you stray for too long!

[4/6] Gana: You see, a lost man is staking out in a camp on the nearby cliff faces. It pains us to see him, but be unable to reach him.
[5/6] Gana: The canyon creatures there are ruthless, and we are not suited to physical combat. We would be able to reach him, but we would be stranded ourselves.
[6/6] Gana: So we ask you to guide Seluc to us. We shall send you to him, and you shall bring him here. If you wish to help, you will be rewarded for your time.

[8/8] Drale: I'm not. I know I'm not. We need to find the ship. If we don't, who knows what...
[1/1] Drale: Anyway! Here's the elevator! Just step on in, and we can head on up to the laboratory.
[1/3] Drale: Hrrgh- You're- you're not a cow?! Why were you... I just said all that, and you could...

[3/3] Drale: Er... Come on, into the elevator! You want to get back to normal, right? Besides, you'd need a key to get in there, and I don't know where you'd find one of those, haha!
[1/1] Drale: ...Moo. Yep. I agree. Come on, let's get going. Into the elevator.
[1/1] Drale: Hm... Oh, hi! Welcome back to my office!
[1/3] Drale: Oh, this is- Oh! You're alive! I, ah- heh. Sorry about... all that. I really, really need to label these levers properly...
[2/3] Drale: Right! Right. You've seen... all that down there, then. I just hope you won't think less of me for it.

[1/3] Drale: ...Oh. Right. Gosh, how long has it been since I-...
[2/3] Drale: Okay. Alright, yes, I'll give them better positions. And I'll- I don't know. Apologize. Give them a bonus.
[3/3] Drale: It's been... hard, recently. We've been working to get back home, and I guess I just... Put too much of myself into that. It's fine! Don't- Don't worry about me.
[1/4] Drale: Oh. Right, your body! I can fix that! We just need to get back to the machine, and... Poof. You'll be back to normal!
[2/4] Drale: ...I hope. Hey, being a cow isn't so bad! If- If it doesn't work, we can make you a home here...?
[3/4] Drale: Uh... It'll work. I'm sure it will work. It's always- always worked in the past! Heh...
[4/4] Drale: Anyway! Let's get going!
[1/7] Drale: So... How have you been? It's been a while since our adventure at Katoa Ranch, hasn't it?
[2/7] Drale: Well, you've been turned into a cow... Obviously... But besides that!
[3/7] Drale: Me? Well... heh. I've been doing pretty well, all things considered. We've been gathering exiles from all over the province! Set up a city to hold us all while we work towards...
[4/7] Drale: It's a long story. I can't tell you everything- not yet. But... All of us here, we don't belong here. We just want to go home.
[5/7] Drale: And- and maybe if we can find our ship again, we'll be able to prove that we're not irredeemable. That whatever we went through- that it won't define us.
[6/7] Drale: ...Heh. Don't- don't worry about it too much. For now, this place is enough of a safe haven for us. It'll have to be enough until we succeed.
[7/7] Drale: We're so close. I can feel it. Just... Just a little while left to go.
[1/1] Drale: Anyway, uh... Here's the elevator! Just step on in, and it'll take us back to the laboratory.
[1/3] Drale: The- oh. Uh... It's nothing. Nothing to worry about.
[2/3] Drale: It just leads to... maintenance. Yep! Just- just maintenance. Nothing else.
[3/3] Drale: Into the elevator now, come on! You need a key to get in anyway, and I definitely don't have one laying around!
[1/1] Drale: ...You're worrying me, friend. Come on, let's get going. Into the elevator, let's get you back to normal.

[3/4] Drale: Uh... I really should get back to work. But- hey! Feel free to visit whenever you want! You'll be able to use the entrance at Ranol's farm.
[4/4] Drale: Maybe I can tell you more about what I've been up to! That'd be nice.

[1/7] Irlok: Welcome to Bantisu Temple, traveler. We guide lost souls onwards, be they wandering men to town or spirits unable to exit the canyon.
[2/7] Irlok: However, recently our job has become much more difficult. The canyon shakes, and changes. Often, long-buried creatures are released as the walls shift.
[3/7] Irlok: And unfortunately, the worst has come to pass, that one of these creatures is hostile. The Bantisu monks of old collapsed the entrance to its cave to seal it away...
[4/7] Irlok: ...but the rubble has shifted, and the cave is open once more. We were not strong enough to defeat it then, and we are not strong enough to defeat it now.
[5/7] Irlok: Even trying to collapse the cave again has ended in failure, for the beast, Krolton, slays our mages and demolitionists in but an instant.
[6/7] Irlok: However, the word on the wind tells tales of humans doing the impossible as a matter of rote. Krolton must be dealt with before it leaves the cave- I beg your assistance!
[7/7] Irlok: We've no time to spare. I will prepare a short spell to bring you to the cave- Please, wait outside, and prepare yourself.
[1/3] Irlok: I apologize for the suddenness of this, but you must understand the urgency. We have no way of knowing when Krolton may emerge.
[2/3] Irlok: We will pray for your safety, and that your spirit will not become among those we must guide out of the canyon.
[3/3] Irlok: Now, hold tight, and godspeed!!
[1/4] Death: IT SEEMS I HAVE A NEW GUEST. WELCOME.

[1/1] Death: FEET OFF THE TABLE PLEASE.

[1/6] Irlok: Oh, thank goodness. You've returned- not free of wear, but certainly alive. Did you need to flee from Krolton, or is he...?
[2/6] Irlok: Truly? The beast is dead?
[3/6] Irlok: Gracious, I don't think I've ever been so relieved. Krolton was responsible for thousands of deaths long ago. You've prevented an oncoming massacre!
[4/6] Irlok: Bantisu Temple owes you a great deal. Here, then- a suitable reward.
[5/6] Irlok: A powerful Bantisu artifact, as reward for defeating a beast that menaced in antiquated times.
[6/6] Irlok: Safe travels, human. Whether it was luck or strength that had you prevail, I pray it will not fail you in the future.
[1/1] Irlok: We have a job that needs doing, but I'm afraid you're too weak. Come back when you are level 87.
[1/1] Irlok: You are truly an amazing warrior. Thank you for putting an end to Krolton.
[1/1] Irlok: I have written the coordinates of the cave Krolton hides in, in your content book.
[1/14] Narder: A human? Agh! Don't worry about getting me medical attention, I've got this under control...
[2/14] Narder: It's a broken leg. I'm already getting it treated, but I have a job to do elsewise- and a time sensitive one, too.
[3/14] Narder: I won't be able to do it like this, but it doesn't matter if I'm the one who carries it out. It just needs to be done.
[4/14] Narder: I don't work for villagers, I was hired to come here by other humans... there's something you must keep secret.
[5/14] Narder: Swear it! If you're going to take the job, and my payment for it, you must be silent about it!
[6/14] Narder: Do you agree?
[7/14] Narder: Good. To business then.
[8/14] Narder: There is a hidden town in the canyon here. Up in the mountains- it was built and run by humans.
[9/14] Narder: Now, the villagers have very strict rules about humans living in their lands, and it's VERY illegal.
[10/14] Narder: I was contacted by the Mayor because he is aware that the town may have become... compromised.
[11/14] Narder: The job is to figure out who and why, of course. To let this slip could collapse the treatise between our races.
[12/14] Narder: I've never been to the city in the mountains, but I was given instructions. Here, I'll write down the location in your book.
[13/14] Narder: Be aware though, they won't let you in unless the area is safe. They can't risk villagers wandering in.
[14/14] Narder: Good luck.

[6/7] Sensei Miyagi: As long as I may teach others and bring them to new heights, I am satisfied. Whether your aim be merely to sharpen your skills or to allow me to retire, you are welcomed.

[1/1] Challenger Apprentice: I congratulate you my friend on your success in the challenges, but the real reward in this situation is the experience, not the physical reward!
[1/1] Challenger Apprentice: I congratulate you on your recent success regarding the four challenges. I envy you and your success.
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Here we are then- The  Room. Here tests your agility! Even these old bones can scale this room in short order- How shall you fare?
[1/3] Sensei Miyagi: I recognize your skill, and you have passed the challenge of the  Room! Hoho, but the next challenge has defeated many an apprentice.
[2/3] Sensei Miyagi: Now, comes the  Room! Here, your combat prowess shall be put to the test. Martial skill comes easily to me...but what of your own?
[3/3] Sensei Miyagi: I hear many things about human combat skill, so I believe I shall watch this challenge myself. Enter now, challenger!
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Defeat the dummies, and bring their tokens to the door! Simple, yes?
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Show no fear, challenger! There is no shame in failing.
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: And worry not, the  Room is reinforced against all manner of attacks. Run wild, hoho!
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: It is fascinating to see how you battle. Very different from my stylings!
[1/4] Sensei Miyagi: And I am to recognize your combat skill, and proclaim your passage of the  Room. Well done!
[2/4] Sensei Miyagi: Next, however, is not a challenge of physical skill, but of observation and logical reasoning, in this- the  Room. Here, a puzzle awaits.
[3/4] Sensei Miyagi: You must discern the path in order to bring the red block to the gold block. Simple in theory...complex in practice, as are many things.
[4/4] Sensei Miyagi: Remember this as you work- Change your perspective, and the reality changes.
[1/4] Sensei Miyagi: And there, I recognize your mental acuity! You have passed the  Room. You are doing quite well, but many have gotten to this point and had a single point stymie them.
[2/4] Sensei Miyagi: Welcome then, to the last challenge I offer you, held within the  Room and cavern.
[3/4] Sensei Miyagi: Your task here, is to become tranquil, and at peace with nature. What that entails... I leave up to you.
[4/4] Sensei Miyagi: There are many paths to tranquility. Whatever you choose, you will know when you have reached the point of success.
[1/7] Sensei Miyagi: I see it now. The troubled heart you came here with is troubled no longer. I recognize your mastery of the  Room.
[2/7] Sensei Miyagi: Oh hoho... It is just like a human to do what cannot be done. That is each challenge of my humble dojo, completed!
[3/7] Sensei Miyagi: So! While I did advise you not to feel pressured of it, I am curious, young master. Do you wish to take my place here, so I may sit these old bones down?
[4/7] Sensei Miyagi: ...Ah, of course not. Despite your mastery, this is merely a single step on your journey. Needn't worry, I understand completely.
[5/7] Sensei Miyagi: I am certain that I will find a suitable successor before my time comes- and equally as certain that I've many a year to go, hoho!
[6/7] Sensei Miyagi: Nevertheless, you have completed the challenges of this humble Sensei, and as such, I will provide you what was promised.

[7/7] Sensei Miyagi: Wear this [Master's Gi] with pride, and remember this final lesson- There is never a point in life that you will stop learning. See the world and its lessons every day of your life, young master.
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Hoho... Yes, this old man still has plenty of life left in him. Do not waste the gifts you have, young master.
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Of course, you wield a weapon to battle, so of course it is different from unarmed combat, hoho...
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Perhaps you may be interested in learning to fight unarmed after!
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Oh, this is getting quite good. I should get a snack to eat while I watch...
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Hmhm, I'll be right back! Continue fighting- And do not worry if you finish before I return! I will be quick!
[1/1] Sensei Miyagi: Ahh, there we are. Now come on, addled old brain of mine, where were we...
